Hudsucker ProxyMy friend ranks Hudsucker higher.  I love the Cohen brothers but this was a disappointment.

reviews.review_title: The Dude abides... I take comfort in that
reviews.content: Where to begin? This is my all time favourite film. That's a start, I suppose. This, like Pulp Fiction, is one of those films that just exude coolness. Cool is the best way to describe the main character of the film, The Dude, a man who ambles through life in a haze of ganja smoke and freaky dreams. He also loves bowling. Featuring some of the greatest characters (and indeed performances) in film history, TBL tells a wonderfully imaginitive story, that, although is disjointed, is held together by the Coens' trademark flair for dialogue and repeating of themes. A celebration of every no-hoper in the world, TBL has a lot to say - it just can't be bothered to say it. Come on man, let's go bowling...

What can i say about this film. ive recently watched it on video. ive watched fargo and that was the main reason why i purchased this movie. i thought the coen brothers have a gift and wondered if this same gift is used in this movie. in my opinion this is probably better than fargo. steve buscemi and john goodman are absolutely hilarious in this movie. especialy when donnie says one word in a conversation with a quick reply of 'shut the f##k up donnie' from goodman. but lets not take any thing away from jeff bridges who as the 'dude' is so good at being so chilled makes me laugh. the dream sequences made me crack up as well with jeff or the 'dude' doing his little dance down those huge steps. all in all a pleasure to watch one of my top 10 movies. 'well at least im house broken'

reviews.review_title: How is this like Vietnam, Walter?
reviews.content: Another fine performance from one of the greatest and most underrated actors working today, Jeff Bridges. He gives us the Dude, a lovable waste of space who gets caught up in a chain of events he has only a tenuous understanding of. Along with his crazed vet friend Walter (John Goodman: Comedy Genius)and hapless Donnie (the fabulous Steve Buscemi)he attempts a number of schemes and plans which start with him trying to rescue his soiled rug (Well, it really pulled the room together). Getting in his way are nihilists, crazy artists (Julianne Moore), "pederast" bowling opponents (John Turturro) and marmots. Oh, and the soundtrack features Kenny Rodgers. And ignore the rumours; different to Fargo, not worse. What are you waiting for?

Man, do I love this movie. I've seen it a few times, and it gets better with each viewing. Jeff Bridges character is one that could not have been played better by anyone - this is one of those roles that seems so perfect, so real, that it will forever define the actor who played it. Jeff Bridges will always be "The Dude".I also loved the roles that John Goodman and Steve Buscemi played. Goodman's manic Vietnam vet is hilariously earnest, and Buscemi has an uncharacteristically quiet role, which is put to great comedic effect in relation to Goodman. One of the little things I like so much about this movie is the portrayal of the friendship between the three characters. It feels completely natural, which may say a lot about me and my friends. I love this aspect of the movie.The dialog is superb, and there are many throw away lines that you may miss if you've only seen it once. A wonderful film that just gets better with age.

What can I say? This is one of my favourite films to date. The Coen brothers have done it again; have they ever made a bad film? Well Barton fink was odd but still not bad. Jeff Bridges is The Dude, literally. I find it very strange that the hero of this story is a loafer who just wants to drink White Russians, get stoned, and bowl, but it works a treat. I found myself getting caught up in their world. John goodman played a great role as The Dude's friend Walter and Steve Buscemi filled the part of poor old Donny. The story is humorous throughout although brief sadness is found, but even this is used to humorous effect. Okay it isn't one of the most intricately woven plots ever but the dialogue is expertly written and the characters superb. I recommend this film to anyone who is a Coen brother's fan (that really goes without saying) and anyone who sees a bit of The Dude in themselves (which, if we were honest might be a lot of us) oh, and anyone who likes cool movies.

reviews.review_title: The Cleverest comedy of all time?
reviews.content: The Coen brothers have a reputation for tight scripting, dark humour, intricate plots and of course, original types of violence and this film is no exception.  The Big Lebowski focusses on a rather lazy and casual seventies dropout by the name of Geoffrey Lebowski who gets caught up into the world of rich billionaire Geoffrey Lebowski, already you can sense the Coen atmosphere.  The film focuses on the seventies drop out (who refers to himself as the dude) and two of his closest friends, the other two members of his bowling team.  The plot isn't really important, bearing in mind that it is actually very hard to define which element of the film is the plot because it changes so rapidly. The Coens bring together all sorts of odd ideas and peculiar settings and bind them tightly into one compact film, and it's one of their best.  The script is absolutely impeccable (It's Coen, what do you expect) including elements of slapstick, razor sharp wit, marvelously original scenarios and an enormous span of diverse characters. The directing is also sublime, the lighting effective, the camera techniques subtle and almost comical in themselves and the performances by the cast are the height of all their careers.  Jeff Bridges is perfect as the Dude and Steve Buscemi and John Goodman play his bowling buddies to perfection.  Julian Moore is also excellent and Tara Ried makes a marvelous debut as Bunny Lebowski (such a shame that she started to do less sophisticated comedies such as American Pie. The film is accompanied by a brilliant soundtrack and has a nicely relaxed atmosphere, the film also manages to never take itself too seriously and reminds us that it is after all just a film for our entertainment, they're not trying to proove a point or change the world, just make a good film. They succeeded with flying colours, I wouldn't change a single second of it.

reviews.review_title: It is a crime this did not receive an Academy Award
reviews.content: I can say without a doubt that this is the Coen Brothers best film. Though they have made many other great movies and are two of my most favorite directors/writers in Hollywood now, they absolutely shine with The Big Lebowski. The funniest thing about this movie is how all of the peculiar and hilarious characters and situations come together so gracefully. Where Raising Arizona and Barton Fink tried fairly successfully at accomplishing this feat, the Big Lebowski does this flawlessly: The Dude's crazy dream sequences, Walter's paranoid, infuriated ramblings about history and American policy, the ridiculous dialogue between the Dude, Walter, and Donnie, Maude's elitist LA interactions with the Dude, the aggressive German kidnappers, and the narration of the strange Cowboy, played masterfully by Sam Elliot all merge seamlessly to form a comedic masterpiece that gets better on repeated viewings. Like the hugely successful show Seinfeld, the main characters, Walter and the Dude, never seem to accomplish anything of any value, but the combination of Walter's incompetent aggression and the Dude's incredible misfortune produces a story as complex as it is funny. At the end of this movie, you may be asking yourself what you just saw and what good came from all the foul language and unusual dialogue between Walter, the Dude, and the other characters in the movie. The best thing is to just sit back and laugh uncontrollably at the strange situations the characters find themselves in, along with the accompanying dialgue. Every time I watch this movie, and it has been quite a lot, I pick up new quotes and find new things to laugh at. As mentioned in the summary, the fact that out of all the Coen Brothers films, the only two to win Academy awards was Fargo and O Brother Where Art Thou is a travesty and does a disservice to the inherent comedic genius that this movie displays. Although I hate saying never, I don't think a movie of this comedic magnitude will come out again.
It's all been said before, so to summarize:One of the funniest, most quote-able movies of all time.Superb acting, and amazing dialogue.A perfect 10 in all respects.

reviews.review_title: 'you are entering a world of pain!'
reviews.content: i asked myself recently, out of all the four hundred or so films that i own, which ONE couldn't i live with out. The Big Lebowski was the answer. The Coen brothers are in a league of their own when it comes to quality control. Everything about this film oozes class, and style, from the opening title sequences, surreal dreams(flashbacks!) and some imaginitive camera work. Good use of colour as well, check out  the bowling balls and the 'Jesus's suit. It's also very, very funny, and the whole of the cast are at their best!'...YOUR REVOLUTION IS OVER SIR!.....THE BUMS LOST!......THE BUMS WILL ALWAYS LOSE'..!!!!!!

From what I've been able to perceive, this film has been vastly overlooked. I've heard that it received bad reviews at the time of its release, and, although I personally enjoy this movie, I wouldn't doubt that many critics missed the point.  I say this for several reasons.  First of all, this film is certainly not for everyone.  Obscene content aside (of which there is plenty) the strangeness of this film will certainly turn off many viewers. Secondly, even if you are interested in a movie as oddball as this, it may still take a while to appreciate.  I myself needed to see it three times before I realized how funny it is.  Now, this may seem like a lot a work for a yield as little as enjoying a movie.  This is not the case.  If you are a fan of any of the other Coen Brothers movies, or, of just comedy movies in general, I implore you to rent this.  Yes, it has the Coen Brothers trademarks (great dialogue and a very interesting and complex plot) but this movie isn't good because of its technical accomplishments; it's just great fun to watch.

reviews.review_title: Johnathan Taylor Thomas' "Man Of The House" does not have sh_t on this!
reviews.content: Every now and then in a lifetime something called The Big Lebowski comes rolling into my sick world. The film follows the story of a disillusioned Eagles obsessive by the name of Jeff Bridges who's tubwaggled into a world of stolen cars, blown toe-nails, and marmots. Once satisfied to idolize Richard Nixon to the tune of an all Eagles soundtrack the Dude finds himself tugged crotch first into a world of international intrigue. Supporting roles includes a militant Rosie O'Donnel as The Dude's brother in law and shooting partner Walter and Steve Buscemi as Creedence fan John Turturro. In short this film is perfect for anyone who harbors a love for The Eagles, Bowling, and White Russians. Take er' easy dude!

In their career Coen brothers won't again reach the high who they released with this movie . Movie based over the vagabond brain of Dude and the ironic and without a possible description of the "jew" Walter , but rarely a movie can be remembered for his superb dialogs and sentences as : "THIS AGGRESSION WILL NOT STAND, MAN." "THE BUMS WILL ALWAYS LOSE!" "HAVE YOU EVER HEARD|OF Vietnam?" "YOU'RE ENTERING|A WORLD OF PAIN, SON." and many others . It's as to describe a landscape colored with millions of colors , a way to walk in an alien heaven , it's how life should be but the potential is it's how life "might be" . Kind of humans with their low vision of this world would not spend a cent as they wouldn't break their ordinary world of fear , fear watching a person who does change own world without pretending to change anything , an anonymous sequence of d.n.a. binary in a world ever biggest than the day before , and Dude swims in this anonymous world , escaping from sharks , humans which lost from their born that free state primitive painted by J.J.Rousseau in Emile . Anything of this movie is a huge smile and a long and bitter laugh about this occidental society .

reviews.review_title: Like good wine... Well, uh, that's just your opinion man...
reviews.content: The Dude Abides... See it more than once; it grows on you. It is mythical. First time I saw it, I was not so impressed, others say this also happens to them, but try it again and something unusual will take shape in you. It is like the proverbial "good wine" kind of thing. With age it gets better and better. And you gotta check out the Lebowski Fest web site - a whole community of "Little Urban Achievers" with T-shirts, bumper stickers, Lebowski Fests. This is a classic movie that can "gently like water cracking stone," change the consciousness of the world (I know...,that seems pretty far out... so sue me!) - Yo, abusive world leaders, (and you know who you are...), be warned! - This is a subversive film - you better ban it or classify it and lock it away before your populations learn to relax and enjoy life! You might think it is only about a stoner anti-hero hero, and it is to some extend, but it is also about ordinary people dealing with stuff they ain't prepared for - being a bigger person than you think you are - handling the messy stuff life throws at you without shutting down and becoming rigid. It is about finding your inner-dude... And maybe, just maybe, this particular movie is growing in popularity at this particular time because of the way things are - the pathetic and clueless leaders we have - the direction they are taking us... yuk! - our seeming inability to do anything about it - the endless frustrations of our menu driven impersonal telephone world - and maybe there is also some nostalgia for the 60's and 70's, when for a brief shining moment, there was a sense of real life happening, and a sense of optimism blooming - that is missing today - "well, uh, that's just your opinion man..."

For a long time my mind was divided between: Monty Python's the life of Brian or Monty pythons search for the holy grail as the funniest film ever. After seeing this latest Coen bros. production, I've had to change my mind. The drugs...the sex...the bowling and the carpet... All summed up when Goodman, looking very unimpressed, turns to the dude and says: "eight years old Dude, eight years old!"

reviews.review_title: I had expected more from the Coen brothers...
reviews.content: Two of my favorite movies are Raising Arizona and The Hudsucker Proxy, and Fargo was pretty good too. I expected a lot from this movie but was somewhat disapointed. The plot was harder to follow than their other movies, and after seeing it twice it still seems kinda stupid. There were too many groups working against and with each other to really pull the end together smoothly. I think there was a lot of great acting, but it didn't really help the movie. But I think they are coming out with a new movie soon, so maybe it will turn out better...

I thought this was one of the funniest movies I have seen in years.  I think that John Goodman deserves an Oscar as best supporting actor.  I can't remember any actor being as funny as he was in this movie.  Maybe Zero Mostel was as funny in "The Producer".  Although the plot was silly, the acting was marvelous.  The actor called "Jesus' in the bowling alley was magnificent.  I watched that scene over and over and laughed each time.  It was a great movie.

reviews.review_title: A strange, but very funny movie.
reviews.content: This movie is great!!!  This movie is about "Dude" Lebowski and his friends, who unwittingly get involved in a kidnapping plot.First, lets talk about "The Dude".  This man is possibly the laziest sucker alive.  He dresses shabbily and lives in a run-down apartment, but that's okay with him.  The only things he cares about is getting high, drunk, or going bowling.  Until his apartment is broken into by thugs who rough him up and p**s on his rug because they mistake him for someone else with the same last name.This dosen't sit well with "The Dude"; that rug is possibly the most valuble thing he owns.  So he goes looking for "The Big Lebowski" in hopes of getting some reimbursment for the rug.  He ends up getting involved in a kidnapping plot involving Lebowski's wife.This isn't your typical comedy; it isn't filled with sight gags or slapstick comedy (although there is some of that).  The humor in this movie concerns the attitudes of the characters.  On opposite sides of the spectrum are The Dude, who is totally laid-back and easy going.  To his friend Walter, who blows up over everything.  This movie also has some subtle jokes you might miss if you aren't paying attention.Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, and Steve Buscemi all give great performances in this movie.  Definitely a modern classic.

I am not a fun of coen brothers, in fact i don't like their films. but big lebowski is really the best film of the season, Bridges/Goodman are really magnificent, also other players (especially John Turturro) are superb too. the only compliant i may have is Julianne Moore, she sucks! Great players (except jm), great performances (except guess who?), great film, ah and really great music. Don't miss this Coen masterpiece!

reviews.review_title: A classic bowling, weed-smoking, satire comedy
reviews.content: This whole film was hilarious, there are few movies I've actually sat at in a theatre and hunched over in my chair laughing.  One of my friends at this movie lacks a sense of humor and even he was cracking up.  Jeff Bridges was hilarious as a bud-smokin, lazy, unemployed bowler and so was John Goodman as a crazed war veteran...The best replayed lines in the whole movie were John Goodman's "you are entering a world a pain" everytime something doesn't go his way and the antics of a femine bowler named Jesus (John Turturro) who always talks in some unknown accent and nonstop commentary.  Some people didn't like the ending, but I thought the ear in the air and the ashes in the face added a twisted blackness to this classic comedy.  Fargo is still the best Coen brothers movie yet, but this still comes in for a close second.  Watch it over and over.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the critics , GO SEE IT !!
reviews.content: Another great movie from the Coen brothers . Even though I've seen it al least 5 times there's still parts that I can't figure out . Anyway John Goodman steals the show (again) . The film is full of laughs with the best line being "you want a toe , shit I can get you one by 3 o'clock , with tail polish " . Don't wast more time reading this , just get in on video or DVD.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films of the nineties!
reviews.content: In 100 years time the Coen brothers will be remembered for Fargo as their 'classic' film, but their most celebrated film is not their best, Lebowski is the king of funny films. Personnally I find nothing amusing about slapstick comedy, the beauty of Lebowski(and all genuinly funny films, Dr Strangelove, Withnail and I, Annie Hall)is that it uses well crafted characters, intelligence and/or stupidity for reaching the child within. Lines such as "she's gotta feed the monkey" are just so off the wall that it never fails raise giggles, smirks and riotous rolling on the floor. The Dude and Walter are one of the best double acts I've ever witnessed, up there with Lemon and Curtis in Some like it Hot or Laural and Hardy. While critics are afraid to praise new films and rank them with the so called classics, I believe the Coen's will be remembered for this as well as Fargo, the same way that Orson Welles is remembered for Citizen Kane AND THEN Touch of Evil. Fargo AND THEN The Big Lebowski(which is much better!!)

reviews.review_title: If you will it dude, such a great movie is no dream
reviews.content: Since I saw The Big Lebowski for the first time in the movie theaters over two years ago (I saw it twice in the theaters), I have probably watched it between 50-75 times.  I was awed by the overall atmosphere the movie conveyed upon first viewing, and was shocked that every subsequent time I saw it, it just got better and better.  Even to this today, I notice something new and different upon each viewing.Critics who complain that the movie doesn't have a plot miss the point. First of all, there is a plot, albeit a wacky and zany one (a Coen Brother's trademark), that many people may not fully understand on first viewing. Second, the plot is only there to serve as a background for the amazing characters, scenes, and dialogue that the movie focuses on.   The interplay between `The Dude' & `Walter' is absolutely hysterical.  Just one example that comes to mind (I could've picked just about any bowling scene)  is Walter commenting on the Gulf War, comparing `the man in the black pagamas' to the current adversary, `a bunch of f**eaters where towels on their heads, trying to find reserve on a Russian tank' while The Dude is painting his nails.I could go on and on about my favorite scenes, but I'd just have to recite the entire movie, because every single scene is so exceptional.  From the repeated dialogue (`this aggression will not stand', `chinamen', `Pilar'), to the incredible fadeouts and transitions (`that wasn't here toe, dude'), you really have to see it multiple times to understand just how incredibly well-crafted this movie really is.In my mind, The Big Lebowski is the best of the Coen Bros.' movies, outdistancing Barton Fink.  That is an enormous compliment, because I love all their movies.  It is also possibly the funniest movie I have ever seen, and holds a spot in my top ten movies of all time.Arthur Digby Sellers!!!

I have seen this movie more than a dozen times, I often just play it on the DVD while I am doing something else... why?  ....Well,... ...this movie is unlike any other one I have ever watched.  You cannot really categorize it in a particular genre!  It is unique, it is funny, the performances are outstanding and the story line is very original.  The best thing about the story itself is its simplicity (for the lack of a better word).  This movie does not try to teach us, or get a point across, it is just about dude's life who enjoys doing nothing.  Now the Coens took dude's life and turned it to one of the funniest, wittiest and most amusing movie of all times.  The soundtrack complements the story very well (the Coens always seem to have the perfect touch for their soundtrack choice) and Sam Elliot's voice for the narration was the perfect choice. That being said I just have to watch the movie again.....

reviews.review_title: Raymond Chandler, but with bowling, doobies, and the occasional acid flashback.
reviews.content: Words cannot describe the magnificent, wonderful and strange beauty that is 'The Big Lebowski'. Take your typical noir tale of kidnapping, double-crossing and sleazy pornographers, and throw in 'The Dude', a pot smoking pacifist with a penchant for Creedance and white Russians.Without going into the plot, it's an amazing achievement that The Coen brothers have weaved an incredibly intricate film noir story into a bright and colorful comedy with each character funnier and more outlandish than the next.With a fantastic soundtrack, beautiful visual style, a first-rate cast and a tonne of laughs, 'The Big Lebowski' is not only a great film, it happens to be this reviewers favorite Coen brothers outing to date.It's more than noir. it's more than comedy. It's ah... You know... The Big Lebowski, man.

I remember watching this movie for the first time and found it to be pretty good. The second time I watched it I was in fits of laughter. By the third time I was hysterical! This movie has so many in-jokes and funny scenes you simply will not catch them all in one sitting.The story itself as a crime movie is absolutely brilliant. Never have I seen so many characters involved in one plot so well, and all because of a rug! (well, partially). Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, and Steve Buscemi give a magnificent performance, and their friendship on screen as a group of guys doing nothing but bowl and drink beer is one to admire. "The Dude" is probably one of the coolest characters ever created, but to be fair, everyones character has been remarkably developed.This movie is hilarious and if you are looking for something "chilled" and funny then this is it dude!Rating  -5 out of 5-

i'm bored and going to spoil many things, so if you've never seen this movie skip past this review. now.to me, the big lebowski is a scathing social commentary on a few types of burnouts prevalent in the 90s.  now while the typical definition of a burnout is drug related, i would argue that the core trio of this movie (dude, walter, and donnie) are all burned out on life in their own unique ways.  the dude is rather obvious, seeing as he chooses to smoke roaches and drink white russians throughout the whole movie. furthermore, i presume him to be a weed dealer, due to his neverending supply of pot, kahlua, and money.  walter feels that society has been indebted to him for his service in nam, so his irrational righteousness carries him through the story with an award winning swagger.  donnie is the awkward outsider, trying to enter the dialogues too late thanks to his innate timidity.  while these guys seem like an unlikely trio, leave it to the coen brothers to combine them in a rather dysfunctional faction to show the utter pointless absurdity of their lives.from there, the movie centers around the inherent human trait to recycle things that it comes across.  the conversations are circular, the characters all develop vernacular influenced by others, and the most boring conversations turn into a slapstick gag by the rather simple method of immediate repetition.  the coen brothers are masters of characterization (i wanted to slug that pregnant cop in fargo for her accent alone) so it's interesting to watch the characters develop throughout the course of the big lebowski.  you generally don't get a one dimensional look at any character in their movies.the subtlties of the coen bros' movies are what make them borderline genius, and the big lebowski is saturated with all kinds of hilarious quirks that are easy to miss.  check out jesus' coke fingernail on his pinky, or how the cops raid the bowling alley after the gun scene, while walter's borrowed dog runs off (yet inexplicably shows up later).  or even the irony of how the self-proclaimed nihilists are so worked up over getting the money that they don't fit their title, subtly pointing to the core trio as the true nihilists in the movie.  the dude only smokes roaches except when he's in the lap of luxury at the big lebowski's place, where he lights up a spliff. even the middle/upper class work ethic is chastised when the dude shrugs in utter disbelief that he's getting completely discredited because he doesn't have a formal job.  i wouldn't be surprised if these characters were based on people from the coen brothers' past, seeing as they probably were ridiculed as aspiring directors many years ago, and maybe even got told to get a real job on several occasions.i think this movie is their masterstroke, although the hudsucker proxy is indeed wicked too.  most everything is perfectly implemented in this movie, and consequently utterly hilarious.  this whole adventure starts with someone, uh... soiling the dude's rug and ends with the dude getting the most wicked 5 o'clock shadow ever, in between lies the most hilarious social commentary i've seen.however, this movie is COMPLETELY hit or miss.  some people are going to call it incoherent and boring, others like myself will call it genius. either way, the coen bros' caustic sense of humor isn't for everyone. although it's a blessing if you can understand it, seeing as you're treated to the best movies that come out of america, in my humble opinion.

Some parts are funny, but the script isn't that much.Worth watching if you have nothing more to watch, but some parts the "comedy" and the story just seems that the writter is forcing something to "be funny" or to be clever. It's not organic.For sure I feel it's overrated, I heard about it in a lot of places, but maybe since I'm not american, I didn't get some inside jokes or special references.

reviews.review_title: If you like it, you'll love it...
reviews.content: This movie has no point, no structure, it doesn't appeal to a mainstream audience, it isn't cerebral, and it meanders its way to no real conclusion.Having said that, it is a nearly perfect comedy.When I first saw The Big Lebowski a few years back, I was somewhat disappointed with it.  But this movie just gets better with each viewing and it is now easily one of my favorites.  The dialogue is just hilarious (despite some excessive profanity) and the interaction of the main characters is thoroughly entertaining.  Good acting all the way around although Goodman and Bridges stand out.  In general, this is just a "fun" movie to watch.

Outstanding performance by Jeff Bridges.  John Goodman did well also. It's a fine movie, I liked it.  Jeff definitely is a great actor, and he seems to like this kind of characters.  He did something alike in American Heart. It's a good portrait of lazy man, a pacifist, a man who just doesn't like problems or complications.  He just wants to bowl, as well as his friends. See it.

I saw this movie on terrestrial TV about a year ago after hearing so much about it. After watching it, not a day goes by without me laughing about a particular scene in it. It is one of the Coen's finest movies, and definitely their most underrated. Three actors make this movie a classic: Jeff Bridges, John Goodman and John Turturro. Bridges is a terrific actor who is extremely underrated (much like the film) and there is no actor who is more perfectly cast for the role of 'The Dude' than Bridges, who brings immeasurable panache to the role of, basically, a drifting stoner. Goodman, a Coen regular, is given his meatiest film role yet and he grabs it with both hands. Admittedly, he is given some terrific lines but Goodman fills Walter Sobchak with humanity as well as humour. Turturro is given the slimmest of cameos but his queer Latino bowler, Jesus Quintana, is without doubt the best cameo EVER in a movie. No question. Also, how can you not love a movie that casts both Sam Elliott and Philip Seymour Hoffman?

You have to love the way this movie just ambles along. The plot more or less takes a back to seat due to the characters who simply shine all the way. The Dude simply rules the movie, and Walter and Donny are the perfect foils for his laid back attitude. The dialogue is just sublime. I believe this movie requires a number of watches to get every nuance of the comedy, and the classic lines lose nothing with repetition. The best that thing the Coen Brothers have done (which says a lot), and should be the benchmark for every movie of it's genre.

reviews.review_title: One of the best comedies/enteraining/unique movies EVER
reviews.content: This movie is hilarious. It has an awesome story, great soundtrack, amazing performances all around (Especially Goodman/Daniels) and has unlimited replay value.Simply put if you consider yourself funny or have a good sense of humor, this movie will make you laugh. Having dabbled in chronic doesn't hurt either.This is mos def in my top 25 ever! Goodfellas, Godfather, City of God, Shawshank Redemption, Godfather 2, Taxi Driver, Casablanca, Big Lebowski, Lives of Others, Pulp Fiction, Apocalypse Now, Jaws, Munich, Pinocchio, Bambi, Gone w/ The Wind, Animal House, Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon/House of Flying Daggers, A Prophet, The Incredibles, Hoosiers, District 9, Heat, & Seven

reviews.review_title: The greatest comedy that ever was
reviews.content: The Big LeBowski is in a class all by itself. It is not only a great comedy, with lots of laugh and absurdities, it is also a great film, as art. The Coen brothers absolutely MUST do more films like this. I believe it is where they excel. You can't help but love every single character they have fleshed out for you. Even those who get very little screen time like John Turturro as "Jesus Quintana" stick with you. A movie to be seen time and time again. A Cult movie !

reviews.review_title: The green toe gets the green vote!
reviews.content: Joel and Ethan Coen's 'The Big Lebowski' is an absolute cult classic! This film created 'The Dude' as one of the most iconic characters in film. The slow witted, care-free stoner played by Jeff Bridges makes for a hilarious character with biting satire and tongue and cheek humor. He is also complimented with John Goodman's character, Walter, as a Vietnam veteran who can't seem to not relate things to the Vietnam war. His cool and calm personality overshot with an immediate burst of rage conveys a contrast which is both hilarious and extremely entertaining. His character is also famous for the quote "shut the f*** up, Donny" and "Am I the only one here who gives a f*** about the rules?" which resonates in pop culture references today. The great soundtrack featuring famous artists such as Creedence and Johnny Cash really emulate the context of the film and attribute to the overall mood of the oxymoron phrase 'chilled-out- mayhem'. However, this satirical humor is not for everyone, which can really take away from the film for some people. Overall, the story is quite good and the characters are excellent! The amazing surrealist dream sequences also create an atmosphere of 1970's Woodstock and the generation of free-love (and habitual marijuana smoking). All in all, this is a masterpiece and the Coen brother's best film ever!

reviews.review_title: I laughed, I cried -- well OK, I guess I really just laughed
reviews.content: This is one I pull out every year or so and watch and ask "why did I wait so long to watch this one again? There are many scenes and lines that I find run through my head for awhile after I watch this. A number of great performances and it's interesting that over time, this cast looks stronger and stronger. As I watch this movie, it really appears that the cast is having a lot of fun making this film - relationships appear easy and no one seems to have phoned their lines in. I do find that I have to be in the right mood to watch it - it's great release when it's been a particularly stressful week, because in a way there's a lot about The Dude (Jeff Bridges) that appeals - a lot of people would like to be that free, but there's a lot of pent up stress in most people's worlds, like Walter's (John Goodman). Give it a try!

A comedy with a difference, a case of mistaken identity.  The Big Lebowski is an offbeat story with great dialogue and some very strange characters. The juxtaposed personalities of the Goodman and Bridges characters make for some great comic moments, including ten pin bowling, getting stoned and a kidnapping.  The characters are diverse :- a stonehead, a rug, a man called jesus, a vietnam veteran, a millionaire and a floosy, and not forgetting the Germans (all in no particular order and there are many others as well). I've seen this film a number of times and its still worth watching again, it gets better every time.  Watch out for John Turturro's unmissable role even though its fairly minor, hysterical! Long live the dude and people like him.

The Coen brothers' "The Big Lebowski" is perhaps the most entertaining film I have seen in a long time.  This film is a ludicrous parody of mistaken-identity movies, and I mean that in a good way.  Clever, visually appealing, and having an engaging soundtrack, "The Big Lebowski" is the perfect movie to watch when bored, in class, under the influence of some controlled substance, or all of the above.  I find that I can watch it at any time and love it.  I thoroughly recommend this film to anyone with a quirky, random sense of humor and a taste for absurdity.  Above all, it will make you want to go bowling.  Thumbs up.

reviews.review_title: Relaxing to watch, when feeling stressed.
reviews.content: Well, what can I say. It's one of my favourite movies when I feel distressed in the daily s***. This movie makes me feel whole again in one way. Like I don't have to do something, that I just have to live my life, without any bosses or other people who wants to say what I have to do.I gave this movie an 8, it could also be a 9 or 10, because it's just a number. Numbers don't say everything. Well, now I regret that I haven't give it a 9.I recommend this movie for people who come home from a hell of a daily work-day and want to commit suicide. This movie will hold you from doing that.The Dude....yesss...it's just the dude.

reviews.review_title: That rug really tied the room together, did it not
reviews.content: This is one of my favorite films ever. Amazing performances from virtually everyone. So many quotable lines, virtually Caddyshack level. John Goodman amazes me every time I see him and shines (and rants) in every scene. Of the many Cohen Bros films, most of which are exceptional, this is the most fun. Clever story, developed and paced well and just so freaking funny.One of many interesting tidbits, the dudes' $.69 check at the beginning of the film is dated 9/11/91, followed by G Bush senior talking on the TV about Iraq war. The more things change....One last note, on the making of, the Cohens mention Joel Silver suggested (and they ignored) that he should get his rug back. The rug, the catalyst for all subsequent events, is not really necessary and this film doesn't need that Hollywood closure. The dude would just say f' it, let's go bowling.What a brilliant film! "That's not her toe dude"

Like many I'm sure, I've watched this movie so many times, I can quote nearly every line. Needless to say, it is one of the most entertaining and laugh-out-loud stories ever told. But, watching it again recently, I was struck by a subtle theme that I hadn't caught on to before: this movie is very seriously advocating peace, in our lives, in our relationships, and on the world scene. It's a little bit discomforting how this "comedy" unintentionally reminds us that we are still fighting in Iraq after over a decade. Not to espouse my political views or suggest that this is a political film, but this film does focus our attention (via the Walter character) on our collective obsession with violence and encourages us to reevaluate our situation from the Dude's perspective: our communication lines are breaking down, "new information has come to light," and like many of the characters in the film, we should be asking, "WTF are we talking about?!" When "this aggression will not stand," the Dude doesn't raise a fist, "the Dude abides" and "takes it easy." The Dude is a "bigger" man; he IS the Big Lebowski.

There's not much to say about this movie. I enjoyed it, of course not as much as i would enjoy a movie that I myself rated 8 or higher, but this was indeed a good movie. The actors were all on the same line, and what i liked the most about this film is the film setting and the mood that movie puts you in, especially with the astonishing soundtracks that got me in the movie from the start; the only reason why this movie isn't highly rated is because it's slow paced many times, which is not something that I enjoy. But after all this is a perfect movie you can watch on a Sunday afternoon with friends and that's exactly what I did. Maybe don't watch this with your family, you know, swear words.
You know, when I saw that movie, I became Jeff Bridges and The Dude fan. Jeff really greatest actor of all time and The Dude my favorite character. Anyone who love movies must see.

This movie is one of the most shallow yet so so deep movies I've ever seen. So many bizzar characters (which have nothing to do with the plot - what plot???) The plot - none exsistant, at least not a real one. John Goodman was AMAZING. Every muscle in his body yells: "I'm Walter" in this movie. Jeff Bridges was excellent as well, doing a great Dude, one of the best characters I've seen on screen. I watch this movie again and again, and enjoy it every time. The dreams sequences are great, the "erotic" bowling shots are great, and of course "nobody fucks up with the Gesus".10 out of 10.

This is quite possibly the funniest film I've ever seen.  The more I think about it the better it gets.  There are so many classic scenes in this movie that just stick in your memory and never lose their hilarity. Jeff Bridges is stunningly good as 'The Dude', and John Goodman's performance is, as ever, brilliant.  John Turturro also appears in surely one of the most memorable and humorous cameos in cinema history as the perverted rival bowler 'Jesus'.  My only gripe is that the vast talents of Steve Buscemi were a little wasted in his relatively small role, but he still shone through as the timid 'Donny'. It is impossible to list all the great points of this film.  See it at the cinema, then rent it, then buy the video.  I know I will.

Hmmm, bowled me over dude! (knowing look) Oh John G how good were you? I didn't laugh I didn't cry, I simply was... *finish *start *middle in no particular order. I have joined the cult of Coen, amen.- Strike!!!

This movie is simply amazing. I've watched it for the first time in 1998 or 1999, and to be honest, I wasn't very pleased. I thought:It's OK,quite nice, but nothing special. Three years ago I watched it again, and I found it much better. But that wasn't still it.Finally I watched The Big Lebowski for the third time last year and I was really amazed.Maybe I could say "third time's a charm", I don't know, maybe I was to young in 1998 to understand and enjoy the brilliance of The Big Lebowski or maybe it's that kind of movie which keeps getting better and better each time you watch it. It is one of my favorite movies, there's something magical about it.You can watch each single scene over and over again and not get bored. The dialogues are hilarious,but I am aware of the fact, that not everybody would like that kind of humor, but I just love it! Magnifficent performance from all actors, especially Bridges, Goodman, and Buscemi.But supporting Seymour Hoffman, Stormare or Moore are outstanding too. I' ve read that when Cohens wrote the script they had all these actors in their mind and You can see it on the screen! Simple "A must see"!But of course, you know, that's just like my opinion man...Anyway the Dude abides!

reviews.review_title: Interesting characters in search of a story
reviews.content: I finally saw this movie on the strong recommendation of a soon to be ex-friend. Had I known it would be so bad, I would've spent the 2hrs clipping nose hair or cleaning out my chimney.I "expected" a story on line with Fargo (which I thoroughly enjoed), I expected twisted humor, interesting characters and a _complete_ story. What I got, in my opinion, was about 2-3 really good characters, some spicy dialog but a very weak story told in a poor way.I wanted to like it, some of the dialog was rich... in keeping with the Fargo lead but there was really nothing holding it all together. The Coen brothers got desperate and leafed back through their writing journals and collected bits and pieces of interesting characters and thought they would just magically fall together and compose a movie.Big disappointment. I now must watch a "chick-flick" with my wife since I made her watch this.Better luck next time.

reviews.review_title: This is the best movie ever made
reviews.content:
This is the best movie of all time, and I knew this right after I watched it. It's just perfect. Everything in this movie is perfect, the characters are outright interesting from the Dude who manages to keep his head cool by adhering to a strict drug regimen, his buddies, the hot-headed but hilarious Walter and clueless Donny, the other characters, Maude, Bunny, Jackie Treehorn, Jesus Quintana are also very interesting and add their own flavor to the movie. 
The whole story is a sort of whodunit mystery which turns out to be a much ado about nothing, much like life itself - and it was this hard hitting conclusion which made me realize that this is perhaps the best movie ever made.

reviews.review_title: My favorite movie of all time - a perfect movie
reviews.content: If there was ever a perfect movie, it would be The Big Lebowski.  The Coen Brothers outdid themselves with this story about The Dude, an average joe who grew up in the 60's, likes the leaf, and loves to bowl.  Stealing the show are John Goodman as Walter the Vietnam vet and John Turturo as "The Jesus," a flamboyant Spanish pedophile.  Also making an appearance is Flea from the Red Hot Chili Peppers who makes a great techno-playing nihilist. But above all, there's The Dude, Jeff Bridges' most loveable character ever.To tie everything together we have the narration of The Stranger.  The best movie Ive ever seen and can watch it over and over again.

reviews.review_title: Most quotable film of all time
reviews.content: "The Big Lebowski?"  Oh, isn't that the movie about the guy who justs walks around and smokes pot all day?"  People like that shouldn't be dignified with a response.  There's no use explaining the genuis behind this movie to someone of that caliber.  My friends and I were recently saying that this is one of the only movies where you can start it anywhere in the movie and watch it from there, there's not a dull moment to be found. Every actor is great, esp. Jeff Bridges and John Goodman.  Of course, they were overlooked for any awards.  Overall, this is the Coen brothers best work to date, and one day will get it's due.On a side note, was I the only one who noticed Jeff Bridges was wearing that same blue-sleeved baseball shirt in "The Fisher King?"

reviews.review_title: A truly remarkable story about guys bowling!
reviews.content: When people talk about the Coen brothers movies such as Fargo and Raising Arizona are mentioned. I, however, see The Big Lebowski as their all time greatest.They have turned a story about a guy known as "The Dude" into a comedy masterpiece.The Big Lebowski is rather controversial in a way that you will either love it or find it dull and boring. Either way take the time to watch it and decide for your self. I promise you that you are to find at least one of the characters in this movie extremely funny.This is also one of these movies that are worth watching several times.Warning! Do not expect mind-boddling revelations on the meaning of life from this movie. Just sit back and enjoy two hours of truly original and at times hysterical comedy.

My favorite comedy of recent years. Filled with funny, quirky characters and situations as you'd expect from a Coen brothers movie, done with style. The hero -or anti-hero rather- "The Dude" Lebowski may not be a genius, but very likeable nonetheless. You got to love his attitude: While stumbling through a crime mystery apparently inspired by Chandler, Hammett and the like, he gets seriously drugged by a porn producer, is beaten up by a sheriff, threatened with losing his "Johnson", used as a sperm donor by a feminist/artist; and this list of mishaps is not even complete. But amidst all this he's able to smoke some reefers, drink a lot of White Russian cocktails -which I tried for the first time myself after seeing the film, I can recommend it- and go bowling with his friends. At the end someone even dies, but it's the character you least expected to...This is one of those rare movies, that get even better with each viewing. Two thumbs up!

This is by far the funniest movie I've seen in a long time.  It's also the most original and creative of the Coen Brothers' films.  If you like sarcastic humor, or flat-out violent in your-face comedy, I suggest this film.  Don't miss the hilarious scenes inside the character's local bowling alley, or John Goodman's hilarious performance, as a "Jewish" friend of the Dude.  My grade: 10/10

reviews.review_title: to know the Dude is to love the Dude
reviews.content: A simply amazing film with definite cult status, I can watch this movie over and over, especially when I need to be picked up...it's one of those movies that makes you feel safe and comfortable, just because the Dude makes you feel like everything will work out fine. The movie is hilarious, and there are so many great quotes and characters. It is also one of the few films that makes me think LA might be a nice place to live. The music is excellent, the dream sequences are inspired. I enjoy most Coen brothers films, but this one is truly special. It has such a good flow to it. Often, when I really like a movie, I enjoy the first half hour or so more than the rest. This one is entertaining from start to finish. Jeff Bridges, whom I've often liked in films, has really made one of the greatest characters of all time. The Dude abides. Viva el Duderino!

Well, I thought I was till I nearly pi**ed my pants laughing the first time I saw TBL. And the second time..and the third... One of the things that kills me about this movie, and apparently no-one else sees, is the fact that the Dude is SO laid back that he rarely has a thought of his own. Three quarters of his dialogue is only him repeating something he picked up from someone else in the film. He even catches himself almost repeating something he doesn't mean to..."And stay away from my special lad...my f***in lady friend". Did anyone notice what he was wearing in the "Gutterballs" dream sequence? It's the same thing 'Carl Hungus' has on in the "Logjammin'" porn video. The whole plot is motivated by the Dude being influenced by everyone else (mostly Sobchak) and he just floats along with it. Not until near the end when he realizes "My thinking about this 'case' has become very uptight" and actually figures things out for himself, does he really guide his own destiny. I must have watched it 10 times before I caught everything, lot of ins, lot of outs, lot of what what have yous. Lot of strands in the Duder's head. The best comedy of all time, hands down.

this is a really, really, really good movie, people. the thing i really love about it is that the story shot right past me the first three times i saw it; i hardly noticed many of the intricacies of the plot because i was so caught up with the fabulous conversations, one-of-a-kind characters, great music and awesome imagery. but each time i watch this film i notice something new about it. were it not for the ridiculous atmosphere and nonsensical nature of this film, it could be a great detective flick. the story is magnificent.any aspiring writers should take note; this movie seamlessly blends good dialogue, good characters and good story. most of the scenes in the movie carry several different purposes. combine this with an excellent cast and great performances from Bridges, Goodman, and Buscemi, along with just about every supporting character, and you have a classic comedy. i do not use the term classic lightly.the last thing i really like about this movie is that after all of the humor, i found myself deeply involved in the story and the wellbeing of the characters. at first some might find it a little melancholy; i certainly did. but after watching this movie as many times as any other i've ever seen, it lifts my spirits every time. this is the kind of movie my friends and i will be quoting every line from until we're senile. an absolute must see.

reviews.review_title: perhaps, one of the greatest comedies of all time. . .
reviews.content: a magnificently well-thought out comedy that draws its material from philosophy, politics, and bowling.  the brothers follow a seemingly apathetic character who refers to himself as "the dude, or your dudeness, or el duderino if your not down with the whole brevity thing" as he unwillingly becomes responsible for the life of the missing trophy-wife of a wealthy cripple who shares the same last name as the dude. . .lebowski.  rather than relying on simple fart jokes and sight gags this comedy revolves around the question of how one is expected to behave in modern american society and how one exists when one no longer considers oneself to be a member of society. the protagonist is an outsider, a contradiction to the values of the politics that surround him and our willingness to embrace him is the core of this wonderful film.

This is a great movie. Or you love it or you hate it. The thing with The Big Lebowski is that the whole story isn't that important. It's all about the weird characters and the conversations. Plus that it has a great soundtrack and the you get to see the nicest shots of the beautiful game of bowling (even viewed from inside of a ball).It's about this guy named the Dude(Bridges) whose real name is Lebowski , that usually hangs at the Bowling with the crazy Vietnam-veteran Walter (Goodman) who screws up everything, and the shy little guy named Donny (Buscemi!). The Dude comes home after another day of bowling and finds 2 guys in his house that are after a Lebowski, but after a little brainstorming they realize that this isn't the rich Lebowski they were looking for. Before leaving,one of the intruders, the 'Chinaman', urinates on the Dude's rug. The rug that really tied his room together. But the Dude is gonna do something about it ('This aggression will not stand, man).The next day Dude decides to go to the Lebowski they were looking for to report the incident, and to maybe get some money for a new rug. This is the beginning of a hilarious 'adventure', with very funny scenes.
See this masterpiece by the brothers Coen and laugh your head off.You can watch it more than once.

If you've just seen Fargo then take a break before you watch this film, it is very different and as amazing in its own right. The first time I saw it I wasn't so impressed and thought the dream sequences out of sync now I can't watch it enough, and I would recommend reading the W.W. Norton book and then watching the film again and again to see a completely new side to the whole "Lebowski" thing.The book "really ties" the experience together.I can't pin point one specific thing that makes this movie so enjoyable, it's just the summer/kinda California retro look, specifically the lighting, which has a story in its own right. Sam Elliot's character gives use a frame of reference and makes me feel envious of The Dude, a freeloader who writes bad checks for a quart of half and half and just seems to bounce here and there thru life without a worry in the world; just being the "Dude". Far out man......

There is not much I can add to the vast array of comments and praise out there for the Dude. However, I would like to note a bit of surreal trivia from the movie.In the opening scene we see the Dude buying milk at the grocery store, nothing special you might be thinking; but when he goes to pay a the register, note the Date of the Check he is writing and the news-clip on TV immediately afterwords...It is Chilling to say the least, I'll not say more, simply watch the movie once more to witness one of the more bizarre cases of premonition by chance. (10 years to the Date!) By the way, the Box set for this movie is Fantastic--lots of goodies! p.s. How I love the Coen Bros. and all the fine talent they cast in their movies. Three Cheers!

reviews.review_title: A dude gets involved in a kidnapping mystery when he is mistaken for a like-named millionaire.
reviews.content: If you're not one to be offended by a lot of swearing, you can't afford to miss this movie.  I've never laughed so much, or found so much quotable material in one picture as I did in The Big Lebowski.  If you haven't seen it, do.  If you have seen it, let's go bowling.

reviews.review_title: One of the most hilarious movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski isn't the greatest movie of all time. It's not even the greatest movie by the Coen Brothers, that would be Fargo. It is the funniest movie I have seen in a long time though. The characters in this movie are so screwed up in the head, and everyone has to love the bowler Jesus and all of the nihilists. The movie is hilarious from the start, when Dude's rug is soiled, to finish, with the scattering of Donny's ashes. This movie has it all: bowling, millionaires, trophy wives, worthless bums, kidnapping, nihilists, action, kidnapping, Vietnam Vets, botched ransom, car theft, heart attacks, missing toes, Jesus, pornographers, corrupt cops, acid flashbacks, dream sequences, sex solely for the purpose of reproduction, and on and on and on. If you don't laugh until you can't see straight, you don't deserve this movie. Movie makers should think up things like this instead of supposedly funny films like Mafia

reviews.review_title: the funniest film i have ever seen!!!
reviews.content: A Coen brothers masterpiece!!!!!!! if you haven't seen this film prepare to laugh your troubles away due to the superb performances of steve buscemi, jeff bridges and the supreme John Goodman whom i feel gives his best comedy performance ever! deadpan, sarcastic and a must for anyone who enjoys bowling or rugs!

reviews.review_title: He was the man for his time and place.
reviews.content: Not a viewing goes past that I don't laugh at this movie. Whether it be the rammblings of Walter, the constant drug referances, or the Jesus. I can't say much about this film, surprisingly enough. All I can say is this: It has more of a complex plot than you think, it has a distinctive style, and gives more than a few laughs. Try it out sometime, dude.

I thought the movie was just plain great.  I admit I thought the f-word was used a bit much but hell in some areas of the country that is the way people speak and is natural.  I thought that the coen brothers did a wonderful job of writing and directing.  what I liked most about it was the fact that unlike other movies it didn't stick with the one plot, cause life is not like that.  The movie was about "The Dude"'s life after his rug was soiled and all the s**t that happened after it.  the film had great character development and great wit and humour.  as I said the film was all around "great".

reviews.review_title: Funny Movie with a little bit of depth
reviews.content: This movie is hilarious, the casting in this movie couldnt have been more perfect.  Jeff bridges does a great job as the "DUDE" a pot head from the 70's who doesnt seem to do much but bowl, and "have the occasional acid flash back".  The dude then gets caught up in a kidnapping and him and his buddies have to figure out what to do. I recommend this movie to people who are not offended by vulgar language and are in the mood for a good hearted movie about buddies

reviews.review_title: Big Lebowski unfairly treated by many
reviews.content: I have seen this fine film numerous times, and still find it to be a hilarious piece of cinema. However, many of my friends and associates continue to insist that the Big Lebowski is a waste of time. Most of these people have not even bothered to watch the movie a second time. It is not until seeing it again that the movie does not make sense. I urge anyone who has seen this movie once, to rent it, and watch it again, it will be worth it. And if you haven't seen it, rent it, and watch it twice... If anyone has met resistance when preaching the creamy goodness of the Big Lebowski, please contact me.
Quite possibly the funniest movie I've ever seen.  Also one of the most under estimated movies, though it might take two viewings to really take it all in.

reviews.review_title: A bizarre, superb, disturbing, hilarious cult classic
reviews.content: My friends and I have seen this several times and we agree that it is a dark comedy up there with Dr. Strangelove.  It has elements of greatness on so many levels that are not apparent at first. The bad box office turn-outs were easily overshadowed by its popularity in rental and VHS/DVD sales, very similar to what happened to a lot of great movies, such as "Blade Runner".Essentially this film, in a nutshell, is about a slacker in the early nineties whom, in the first several minutes, is beaten up by two thugs in his own home, one of which soils his rug, then realizing that they kicked the proverbial 'crap' out of the wrong guy, they leave.  This slacker (Lebowski), goes on an odyssey to find the men who saturated his carpet, which ultimately gets him mixed up in a kidnapping case involving German nihilists trying to cut off his genitalia, including a late night bathroom attack by a trained attack marmot.Lots of memorable scenes, characters (Such as Jesus, the perverted bowler), and very twisted humor, some of which may be considered offensive, seeing as a scant several scenes features brief nudity.It's symbolic for society, some might say, as the Big Lebowski is a very 'achieved' man, where as, the hero, the Little Lebowski, is a foulmouthed slacker, but in the end, through confusion, the Little Lebowski turns out to have been taken advantage of.A four star comedy.
Very entertaining.  I was laughing from the first minute to the end.  Lots of surprises too, reminiscent of Pulp Fiction but not quite as dramatic or shocking.

reviews.review_title: One of The Best Comedy Ever
reviews.content: I'm a Coen Brothers fan, so when I See "The Big Lebowski" in DVD, I Bought It. I wasn't old enough to understand this film when It came on Theater so I didn't see It. Now I had the opportunity to do. Final Results : It's a pure wonderful achievement by The Coen Brothers.The Screenplay : The story is very original,the characters live in a very confusing L.A (Maybe it's like that) and they are very wealthy and varied, "The Dude", "The Big Lebowski", "The Nihilist"... All these characters are different and when they collide it make very special situations. These situations are varied too, like the places. This is not a film with just two or three places, we can see very different places of L.A.The acting : Just one of the most hilarious performances I've ever seen. Jeff Bridges was the only one to play "The Dude", with his long hair and some pounds more he's unrecognizable but not his performance. And John Goodman I think gave his most memorable performance, even the small supporting roles are good too (Steve Buscemi, John Turturoo).The Directing : Coens Classic, They interesting about there characters, even there isn't a lot of close shot, the "high states" of "The Dude" are pretty good, without using a lot of special effects, like this they make the scenes more realistic, it's a comedy film not a sci-fi movie.Conclusion : A excellent comedy with great performances.And don't forget : "The Dude" stays up

reviews.review_title: Possibly the greatest comedy ever. A true gem.
reviews.content: As far as I'm concerned this is easily the very best movie the incredible Coen brothers have made to date. Comedy is one of the most difficult, demanding genres around, and in order for it to work it must be made with a professionalism that exceeds all imagination.  Now that's one of the many great things about "The Big Lebowski". Everything in this movie is sheer genius, every detail is right, and the timing is perfect, but it feels so laidback you hardly notice the brilliance and skill.What else can I say ? The Dude is just about the coolest main character you can possibly imagine, and he's surrounded by a hilarious troupe of supporting characters that make this film a truly worthwile event. Walter Sobchak, Donnie, the three nihilists, the Jesus, Maude, Jackie Treehorn, Brandt, Knox Harrington ... they're all hysterically funny.  Same goes for the nonsensical situations The Dude gets into. The first appereance of the Jesus, the farret scene, the toilet scene ("Where's the money Lebowski ?"), the confrontation on the parking lot, the money handover, the beach scene, and so many more wonderful moments - I'll kick myself for not mentioning them later... they can make anyone with a sense of humour howl with laughter, again and again and again.The cast is tremendous: Jeff Bridges is in my opinion one of the best American actors around and as The Dude, he finally got the chance to show what a remarkable comedian he really is. John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, John Turturro, Julianne Moore, Philip Seymour Hoffman... each and every one of them gives a new meaning to the word "delicious".In short, this movie is such a feast of wonderful dialogues, hilarious characters and unbelievably funny scenes it's already a true classic. The Dude abides, man, The Dude abides...

reviews.review_title: The Coen Brothers made another Cult-Movie
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski is the best Comedyfilm, I have ever seen! The Dude is such a looser- unbelievable. ..and how happy he is, when he may take of his clothes at the doctor. The dream sequences in the film are really good too. The best thing is when the Dude and Walter are trying do bring the money for Bunny Lebowski. But why are the Germans shown in such a strange way? ;-( Doesn`t matter - GREAT FILM!!!

Best movie ever. How can you go wrong when your protagonist is named The Dude (or his dudeness or el dooderino). Anyway, if you haven't seen it hopefully you'll realize what you're missing.And that's just, like, my opinion, man.

This movie really tops all other comedy's. From the opening scene, the dude in his morning robe in the supermarket, the old fashioned telephone which keeps on ringing. Every line in this movie is one to remember and every character is so good it makes you smile if you think about them. And it's a movie which get's better with every viewing. I find humor so much better if it's so dry you keep wondering if you should laugh out loud or implode...What to say, you've got to see this. More then once!

reviews.review_title: Still as fresh as when I first saw it
reviews.content: I had the luck of seeing The Big Lebowski during a sneak preview in late March of 1998 here in Belgium. The room was packed, and afterwards applause erupted. The entire audience stayed seated and clapped until the final credits rolled. Since then I've seen it numerous times. I introduced my little brother to it when he was 14, only for it to become one of his favourite movies too. Quotable, quirky, quintessentially Coen. 10 stars!

After watching the heavenly film The Big Lebowski, I realized that no matter how hard life is, there's always The Dude that makes our lives so simple. It's good knowin' he's out there. Takin' 'er easy for all us sinners. The Dude is some sort of a divine creature, a representative of god on earth. characters like Donny (aka shut the f*** up Donny)and Walter made me think that maybe life is not all about money, cars and clothes. It's about those little moments of happiness when you hit a strike or have an IN & OUT burger. Maybe that's what life is all about.

10 pinning and the occasional acid flashback.When I saw this movie for the first time I was flabbergasted. It was quite simply the funniest movie I'd ever seen... It still is! The C Bros. have once again pulled it off: a masterpiece.The dialogue is second to none and John S. Lyons should have won innumerable awards for his unprecedented casting job! Sure I've met people who didn't like it... But then again I've also met people who didn't care for Roger & Me. I guess we're just on separate planets.The Dude, Walter Sobchak, Donny Karabozoz and the rarely appearing Jesus Quintana are gut splittingly hilarious and the essence of working class heroes! I love'um!Since I fist saw this gem I've bought the movie, the soundtrack and a pair of clear plastic sandals!I rate it supreme...

reviews.review_title: sometimes there's a man, well, he's just the man for his time and place
reviews.content:
Hilarious. The Coen brothers put together a comic gem involving Jeff `The Dude' Lebowski, played masterfully by Jeff Bridges, as an un-employed, white-russian sipping bum who, only wanting retribution for his soiled rug, stumbles into a kidnapping-ransom scenario that has several twists and turns. Along for the ride are Walter (John Goodman), his high-strung Vietnam veteran bowling buddy, Maude (Julianne Moore), the ultra-feminist daughter of another Jeff Lebowski (this one a millionaire, and who's wife it is that is kidnappedif this sounds a bit confusing, well, just watch the movie and it'll all make sense), a pornstar, and a group of nihilists. Oh, and John Turturro is uproarious as Jesus, Walter and Dude's bowling rival.
What makes this movie so good is not the story itself, but rather how the hapless Dude and Walter stumble around, changing allegiances and theories as to what happened to the `Big' Lebowski's wife (again, just watch the movie). The back-and-forths between Walter, the Dude, and Donny (their 3rd bowling partner) are wonderfully written and delivered. The dream sequences are great (Saddam Hussein handing out bowling shows? Priceless) and the soundtrack is excellent. This movie is a classic among college and high school guys, and I'm sure you'll realize why when you see it. All in all, a well written, acted, directed, and funny film.

Full of characters and wonderful, quotable moments. Great, memorable scenes. John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, and Jeff Bridges are outstanding. If that weren't enough, the movie put John Turturro on the map.Like most Coen brothers' movies an injustice that starts a chain reaction of strange, eventually coming full circle to right a wrong. The plot is dark, hilarious and complex (hit the pause button if you get up to go pee). This is one of those rare movies that actually lives up to the hype.Definitely a movie that deserve multiple viewings. Even has bowling. The Big Lebowski would have to be one of the greatest cult classics ever

reviews.review_title: never let a marmot share your bathtub
reviews.content: a magical farago of comical mishaps.perhaps one of the best pieces of sustained anarchy ever.the scene involving The Dude&the cricket bat wielding enforcers as they throw the marmot on him as he lies soaking is surely one of the alltime clasics. A must-see if you you like your humour raw.

reviews.review_title: The best film in a long time.
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski was the first Coen Brothers' film I saw and although I can't say it's an equal to "The Man Who Wasn't There" or "Fargo" in terms of intricacy or overall style - it still remains my favourite by  the Coens'.Jeff Bridges is perfect as The Dude and John Goodman delivers his best performance so far as Walter; an annoyingly loveable Vietnam veteran.The music is used brilliantly to the point that the film and it's soundtrack seem to be insperatable - a feat only accomplished by two other movies in my opinion - Reservoir Dogs and Natural Born Killers.My only complaint would be that Steve Buscemi was a little underused and that his only lines seemed to be a lead into him being told to "Shut the **** up!" by Walter. But maybe that's the whole point.Deffinately a treat for any fan of film, Coen or otherwise.10 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Sometimes confusing plot saved by great characters and quality writing
reviews.content: The first Coen brothers film I saw was 'Fargo'. That was a great film, if a little short. Then I saw this. Now, when I first watched this I expected a gory, dark film like 'Fargo'. What I got surprised me. This film was quite mellow and laid back for the Coens, at least in terms of sheer, gory violence. But then the plot went off in all sorts of directions and at times became confusing but one thing remained noticable, The sheer quality of the writing and the great acting. The Dude is a warm, lovable fool who just wants to live his life and not have people mess it up. For me what made the dude such a great lead character was the quality performance from Jeff Bridges. The way in which he makes the dude appear confused but also clever is totally believeable. For me the dude was one of the most likeable heroes since Vincent Vega in Pulp Fiction. As good as Bridges is as the dude one actor outshines him. John Goodman as Walter. Walter is a mentalist but also a good man and Goodman manahes to portray this with ease. IMO this is his best performance to date. Of course no film would be complete without quality dialogue and The big Lebowski has this in spades. For all the profanity there is real meaning and thought gone into the writing and it helps give character to the characters in much the same way that Glengarry Glen Ross' writing did.

The Big Lebowski is one of the worst movies that I have ever seen. Yet at the same time I love the movie because of its intelligent use of comedy in a situation that deserves alot. The film has liberal use of the F-Bomb and other vulgar words, and at points become over the top. The film has some of the best one-liners i have ever heard that are only funny outside the movie. I watched the film in complete silence only to laugh my ass off 2 hours later when thinking of the "Fix their cable?" line. In the end the movie has no point and ends with nothing happening. It is a series of events that accumulate into ZERO. In the end I was dumbfounded that I had wasted 2 hours of my life on this movie, only to reflect back on the time as well wasted. I know that this review completely contradicts its self, but so does the movie described in to. I would reccomend watching this movie with others to laugh about the jokes in the near future. In the end "No one f*cks with the Jesus"

You hardly could expect more from a movie. There is a great script, with great characters, some of them (Walter) might remain forever in the story of Hollywood. Nice cinematography, specially some clips related about bowling. Nice music, too. Also wonderful performances of Bridges, Goodman and Buscemi, but among all of them, John Goodman(Walter again) raises to the top.But overall, this is an hilarious comedy, a great collection of laughs. It won't change your live, but it could (surely will) make it much funnier for a while. 8/10 (I only give 9 or 10 to things like Citizen Kane and the lot). Sorry about my english.

reviews.review_title: Zen for Boomers: Lebowski as the Anti-Hero
reviews.content: Apart from its burgeoning cult status, this film is seriously overlooked and underrated. Perhaps partially the result of gross marketing misrepresentation. Regardless, you know how there are some films that strike such a cord that you tend to believe you can effectively use them to screen potential friends and lovers? This is such a film for me. Excellent script, generation-defining philosophy (both Boomers and Xers tend to like it the most in my experience) tempered with humor, unforgettable characters and performances exquisitely produced. My favorite film of the Coen brothers' offerings and in my top ten of anyone else's. Great soundtrack, to boot.

For those of us 50+ year olds who were smart but had little ambition and less drive, this film is about one of our own who set his goals low and achieved every one. Yep, he's a slacker and darned good at it.This is one of my favorite movies and I'm not going to add to the good stuff others have said about it. This is really a plea to someone in TV land to turn this movie into an episodic television series. The Dude as a slacker version of Colombo or Rockford.  Walter a perfect sidekick and with Maude feeding them cases to solve ("I know someone who could help") for La La land's quirky side. Done properly this could be a cult TV series to complement an outstanding movie.

This movie made me review my opinion on comedies. I've always been a fan of horror and sci-fi, and not really been in to comedy. Until I met The Dude, Walter and Theodore Donald Karabotsos, that is...The dialogue is hilarious, the characters are genuine, the plot is surprising(to say the least), the casting superb, the story is genious, the soundtrack wow, and Bunny Lebowski is pretty hot...My favourite scene is The Dude and Walter paying their last respects to Donnie, spraying his ashes in to the ocean. The look on Jeff Bridges face, when he is covered in ashes is priceless....So to sum it up...to those of You lesser fortunate who hasn't seen this movie yet, see it-it's great.

_-_-SPOILER MAYBE-_-_-Dude-Attention all realists!  Ok if i dont have your attention whatever.. but those reading let me tell you.This movie is more like a journey.  It is a journey of a man practicing simplicity.  Jeff Bridges as "the dude" portrays a lifestyle completely opposite of the rich and famous.  His manners are laid back and life is cruisin by like the bowling balls down the lane.  The Dude is an avid bowler who likes to burn and drink.  His best friend John Goodman "walter" is another story.Walter is the dudes bowling buddy and is also Vietnam Veteran. He contsantly links everything to the war.  He has zero impulse control and can only be finessed by the Dude.  Basically if there is a situation that can go bad, Walter is diggin the hole quick.watch the movie if you have not already done so.... you will not be let down unless you have a sense of humor that is narrow and warped.Have a great day!
These two men have collaberatively created a brilliant film.

reviews.review_title: I love movies that hold together this well while at the same time being totally unpredictable
reviews.content: Easily one of my favorite movies, by my favorite actor. I've always like Jeff Bridges, but he usually plays someone fairly together and knowing exactly where he's going and how he's going to get there: here, he may be together in a unique sort of way, but he has no idea where he's going and he doesn't care how he gets where ever he's going. Just going' with the flow.As with so many great movies, every character is a gem, and even actors I don't normally like are excellent.When I first watched this movie, I was in a room with my extended family (wife, in-laws, my in-laws in-laws) and within 10 minutes, all but three of us had left the room, overwhelmed by the swearing and a bit disgusted with this character with no apparent redeeming features. Besides my brother-in-law and myself, my brother-in-law's 80-year old Jewish mother-in-law stayed. At the end of the movie we had all laughed a lot, but the best line was reserved for "bubby" who said "I've never heard the word f___ used in so many interesting ways".

reviews.review_title: Very optimistic, perfectly chill outing and just great pastiche of detective movie!
reviews.content: Joel and Ethan Coen - well known post-modernists, the most famous next to Quentin Tarantino, masters in conventions's jugglery, the only Hitchcock's successors in the field of suspense (for example "Barton Fink") once again had a fling at viewer. Once again we are dealing with film labyrinth full of citations, conventions and misleads. Brothers, like always, in masterly way changing conventions, and all of that - accumulation of extremely funny scenes and episodes, funny and witty dialogs and loony characters - drowns in smoke of absurdity. The movie is made - like every Coens production - very shipshape: cinematography (of genial Roger Deakins), production design and set decoration (also great Dennis Gassner) and acting. In the movie we can enjoy such great leading actors as Julianne Moore, Jeff Bridges (his BEST role), great characteristic actors like Steve Buscemi, John Goodman or John Turturro and also masters in supporting like Philip Seymour Hoffman. Important fact is that characters played by Bridges, Goodman, Buscemi and Turturro were written SPECIALLY for THESE actors.
