reviews.review_title: Lot of strands to keep in my head, man
reviews.content: This is one of the best movies, on so many levels. I didn't pick up on how mean this movie is, the first few times I watched it. Jeff Bridges as The Dude is kind of infinitely charismatic, so it's hard to see through to all the really fucked up stuff. He constantly repeats things that other people have said to him, he has a pretty aggressive sense of entitlement, he is a dick to women, and he only seems vaguely sane in contrast to Walter. His solution to all problems is bowling. He doesn't seem to do much of anything besides be a real chill ass dude. Which is hilarious and fun to watch. It is a great movie. I just love the fact that I can find a new layer, three viewings in, and then that makes me want to watch it again, to see if it's right. Fuckin good movie.

If you don't like bowling, then "you are entering a world of pain!" This has got to be one of the greatest comedies ever written. If you watch this the first time and don't get it, you probably never will. This movie is like an old friend. Written with the assumption that you already know what's going on, if you get it, you really will feel like you already know what's going on. John Goodman gives a stellar performance as The Dude's best friend. They also couldn't have picked a better man than Jeff Bridges to portray this lazy yet likable "Dude". The story in itself makes it an instant classic.

reviews.review_title: Why is this not in the top 100?
reviews.content: The characters alone make this film one of the greatest I've ever seen. Jeff Bridges and John Goodman are amazing. The story is timeless, well told, yet unimportant at the same time. You can watch the whole film or pick up watching it at any point, its that enjoyable. Please add to your list of films to watch!

reviews.review_title: Like, this is just my opinion, man
reviews.content: This picture is just grand, man.  But, like, that's just my opinion, dude. It's all about the rug.  It tied the whole movie together, man.  And what's a Coen brothers film without a rich man behind a desk, and a few weird dream sequences...man?  Nods to Bridges and especially Goodman.

reviews.review_title: One of the coolest films ever
reviews.content: Possibly one of the most stylish and amusing films of the 1990s, along with Pulp Fiction and Goodfellas. This film pulsates throughout with the Coen brothers crazy offbeat humour and contains many exciting and clearly hallucinogen influenced scenes, all linked together by the common theme of ten pin bowling. "TBL" contains some of the funniest characters ever committed to film, most notably the latin american paedophilic bowler played by John "No one f***s with the Jesus" Turturro.  The dialogue in this film is as sharp as a very pointy and sharp thing and this is definitely one of the films that must be seen if you are to raise yourself above all the mass produced Hollywood nonsense and gain a true appreciation of what constitutes A DAMN GOOD FILM.
If you have ever felt guilty for being too lazy wait until you see this movie and meet the Dude, the laziest man in Los Angeles. A movie filled with a great sense of humor if you are smart.

I like the Bridges character a lot, simply, I think anyone can identify with him, love him and understand him. I would like to know someone specially encouraged like the Dude to face life like it is, a joke.The performance of all the cast is one of the best actors-team-work I have ever seen on the silver screen. The sequence when they (Dude, Walter & Donny) meet Jesus at the bowling was delightful and hilarious (Turturro was terrific).The Coen Bros. are one of the most creative filmmakers couples the Cinema ever had.

reviews.review_title: Anyone know the song playing in the limo when the dude....?
reviews.content: Hey kids,There's this song I'm trying to find but I don't think it's in the soundtrack. Does anyone know what song is playing in the scene with the Dude and the limo driver (the cool one)? The driver is talking about a big rash on his ass and some annoying stuff, but life goes on. And the Dude is saying how he lost money today and how he was in a bad mood earlier. It's still in the beginning of the movie. I think it's right after he was with Maude Lebowski, and after getting out of this limo he gets forced into another limo finding the old lebowski and brent. If anyone knows what song is playing that would be cool, because it's been bugging the blazes out of me.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest comedies every made.
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski is one of the best comedies there'll ever be.  One of the main reasons this movie did not get the attention it deserved was because of the advertising.  "From the creators of Fargo"  in my opinion killed this film.  Fargo was an art movie that only most critics liked.  TBL is so far from Fargo  its unreal.  I can see how people wouldn't watch it thinking it was similar in some way to Fargo.  Let me give you an example of why TBL is so good, and better than Fargo.  Jesus Quintana.  Jesus will probably be the best character to ever appear in a movie.  The Coen's created an urban legend with Jesus, and then only gave him a few minutes of screen time. This is actually a good thing, however, since having him in the movie too much would ruin him in the same manner knowing the ending to the Usual Suspects would ruin the experience.  Those who love Jesus as much as I do can only live with the fact that we'll never see him in a film ever again. But using him in another film would ruin the character.  So this also is a good thing.  The Coen's did it right with Jesus, a unique character that creates a unique comical experience in a unique film.  The film and Jesus will never be used or revisited for further films, but its comical genius you don't see in a film every day.  So give TBL a try, if nothing else, you'll have to admit it is the best written comedy ever made.

reviews.review_title: One of the most comical movies ever.
reviews.content: Not only is the Big Lebowski funny, but it is also one of the best written and acted films of the 1990's.  The Coen brothers mix dialogue with imagery like none other.  The genius of the film is the script.  Each character's lines help build each scene, by interrupting one another, contradicting each other, and ultimately make the other funnier.  Plus, where else are you going to find the line "The dude abides" or "Don't f*ck with Jesus"?  No where.  You may have to watch the film more than 20 times to really appreciate it, but, it's a feel good movie.  Not like Armageddon, but one that can make you realize what is truly important in life, and how often fragile and humorous it can be.

reviews.review_title: Watch it. Then watch it again.
reviews.content: This film is one of the greatest comedies, if not one of the greatest films, I've ever seen.  But here's fair warning: This is not a film to be watched on a night of drunken partying with your loud buddies.  Every single word must be paid close attention to.  Otherwise, there's just way too much great stuff to be missed.  Not only that, but it begs for repeat viewings.  I guarantee that if you watch this movie five times, you'll pick up on hilarious new lines you didn't catch before every time.  The dialogue in this movie is perfect.  It's some of the smartest comedy I've ever heard. I have to cut it off there, because if I went on to write about all the great things in this movie, I'd be here all day.  Just take the advice of a complete stranger: Rent the movie and watch it immediately.  Then, watch it again the next day.  If it's a five-day rental, watch it every day you have it.  You couldn't possibly be disappointed.  That is all.

reviews.review_title: Identical to the finnish Uuno Turhapuro films
reviews.content: I think this film is a plagiate. At least the films whole idea is. In Finland there is an exactly similar serie of films called Uuno Turhapuro. This guy is called Uuno Turhapuro and hes kind of a whacko like Lebowski. They both have unfriendly father in laws. Well in Big Lebowski the dude didnt marry Maude like Uuno who married for money and made his father in law crazy.. His father in law was a finnish minister and the wheelchair guy is filthy rich important figure. Also Uuno has two crazy and weird friends like the dude. Also the plot is always something funny and a bit nuts just like in Big Lebowski. If you like Big Lebowski or are a big fan of it I recommend the Turhapuro series for you. While this serie of films is not so widely known internationally its creator Pertti Pasanen was a real genius of entertainment and Uuno Turhapuro series are a marvelous creation.

This movie is more real then any of us want to believe.  Why do people think there is no plot.  This movie has an excellent plot.  Just because you don't know the answers to all the questions like a traditional (willis/cage/arnold/travolta/stallone) action movie, doesn't mean that there is no plot.  Most movies attempt to tie up all the loose ends and give a nice easy to understand package.  In the first five minutes you already know that mendoza/rodriguez/castillo etc. is the bad drug dealer and you basically sit and watch while the hero with a tough name goes and gets him. "Good work Steel!  You'll make sergeant for this!"  "Thanks chief!"  That's not how this works and that's now how reality works.  And yes there's a lot of weird characters in it, but there's a lot of weird characters everywhere. Spend a few minutes listening to people instead of avoiding them and you'll be shocked at the amount of characters you run into.  A crazed vet - I know several, a aging hippie who just wants to be left alone - I know him too. Now we all know that pornographers, porn stars, and rich old men with bad intentions exist so this isn't a stretch.  The oddest things would be the German Nihilists, but is this that much of a stretch?  There already exists a similar popular German stereotype from Mike Myer's "Sprockets" bit on SNL.It's the other movies that are fantasy.  An akward kid who makes the team because he's got 'heart' and wins the admiration and respect of his peers. A dorky girl who gets a makeover and becomes popular.  A rogue cop who shoots 50 people and solves the case himself, even though he's "off the case".  A romantic comedy in which the male character does things that would get him arrested for stalking in real life.  Horror movies in which the victims deserve to be killed due to their own stupidity.  Woody Allen sleeping with attractive women.So in summary, mind if I do a J?

didn't get it the first time i saw it on Christmas eve..bummed out by myself..then i watched it again right after...incredible!! this is the best Cohen bros film yet...and gets better each time...even bought the book about the making of it which shows storyboards, etc... this movie is not to be missed..one of my all time favorites..and I've seen a LOT of movies....check it out...you'll thank me....it rox! enjoy!!! if you like it..check out the making of book. This film has all of the regular Cohen actors...Jeff bridges is amazing and the xtras on the DVD are well worth it...esp the part about Sam Elliott having no idea why he was even hired to show up for his part...anyway...great soundtrack..and great actors...the shooting is so amazing..sets the scenes perfectly...awesome!

This movie with its cult status has left me perplexed as to why. Shouting humour is simply not funny, the plot is too fragmented, and far to much left field stuff going on. The plot could've played out far more intelligently. Wasted my time watching this movie.

Rarely do I watch a movie more than 3 or 4 times. I have watched The Big Lebowski at least 27 times in the past three years; it's just that good. Mind bending twists that are shadowed in an "I don't care" attitude make for some truly hilarious scenes. The energy between Jeff Bridges and John Goodman is natural, polar and just plain fun to watch. John Turtorro and Steve Buscemi also add flair to the picture in their supporting roles. The humor in this film is subtle at times; I'm still catching gags that I have not seen before. This is the mark of true genius on the part of the Coen brothers. If you are considering renting this movie, don't. Buy it! You will want to watch it over and over.  If I did not love it so much, I would not have required all of my employees to watch it. This way, when we were in a meeting and one of them would say "eight year olds, Dude," we all knew what he was talking about. Get the movie!

This movie is simply great.  Watch it again, since it's probably been a month or two since you last saw it.  What can be said that hasn't already, other than to comment on the unfortunate (but hilarious) alteration made to the dialogue for the TV-friendly clean edit; when Walter destroys the Corvette in what he thinks is retaliation for the disappearance of The Dude's car, he bellows "this is what you get when you fight a stranger in the Alps."  Fans of the film will recall instantly what this line replaces.The Cohen Brothers are in top form on this one.  Too bad Intolerable Cruelty didn't quite deliver.

This is my first review, because, this is MY FAVORITE MOVIE OF ALL TIME AND EVERY SINGLE PERSON ON THE PLANET EARTH NEEDS TO SEE IT. Not a lot of people see this movie, which is sad because The Big Lebowski has everything. It has crime, comedy, drama, and bowling. And boy, does it have some quotes. The Big Lebowski has so many quotes, that the script is basically just one long quote. It starts off with a stoner, The Dude, coming home to his crappy apartment from the groceries store, and he finds two thugs who promptly shove his head in the toilet and demand money, stating that The Dude is a millionaire. When The Dude says that it's pretty obvious that he isn't a millionaire, they pee on his rug, which really tied the room together.I know it's not on Netflix yet, but it is totally worth the price to buy it. I've seen it over 15 times, and it still hasn't gotten the least bit old. In fact, it had only gotten better. The first time I saw it, I hated it. But when I saw The Big Lebowski a second time, I thought it was awesome. That may or may not be the same case with you.The Dude Abides.

reviews.review_title: More Then It Appears To Be
reviews.content: People view the Big Lebowski as a screwball type comedy that is as heavy on the laughs as it is on the vulgarity.  But there is so much more there. I view this movie as the quinticential Coen Brothers movie because everything they have done in the past is in the movie.  There of course is a large helping of thier special brand of humor that seems to appeal to everybody.  There is a bit of drama from movies such as Millers Crossing, and then there are the thrills that the produced in Fargo.What most people don't see is that it is a modern twist to the classic Film Nor movies.  Watch the classics -The Maltesse Falcon, Chinatown, even the Coen's own Blood Simple- and you will see how much The Big Lebowski has in common with these movies.  I think that if you took Sam Spade out of the '40s and put him in the '90s you would have Jeff Lebowski.  Other common elements the movies all contain is the wide variety of characters, the problem is never solved to the viewers satisfaction, and you can't help but feel for the detective no matter how slimey and shady he is. So I urge you to take another look at this movie and don't just look for laughs but also look for the sheer brilliance of the Coen Brothers because who but they could hide a classic in a comedy.

This is my favorite movie of all time. I keep running into Big Lebowski fans here on the East Coast, so there must be a lot of us. This is the only movie I watch over and over again. The dialog is a bit heavy on the cuse words, but critical to the story of the dude and his rug. The cast and plot make this one of the most stupefying stories I have ever heard. This is the Cohen brothers crowning achievement. Many films are predictable and formula driven. This movie is unpredictable, each time I see it I see something new. There is no other film like it, and when I am a bit blue, I can put this film in and it will always crack a smile on my face!

Greatly underrated Coen Brother's comedy. A simple plot of a slacker involved in a case of mistaken identity - what follows? a nude-swinging abstract artist, 'Jewish' Vietnam war vet gone nuts, German nihilists and beautifully surreal dream sequences.Jeff Bridges is perfectly cast as "The Dude". Along with The Coen brothers regulars, John Goodman and Steve Buscemi. John Turturro steals the show with a fantastically funny performance as a paedophilic bowler.
Beautifully made film, with instantly quotable phrases celebrating the simple things in life.

This movie is an experience as you see the world through the dude's perspective. To some the story is nonsensical and none have satisfactory conclusions, but that is how the protagonist sees these stories and he did not care for how they ended and neither should we. Not for everyone, but that's why I love it!

Without a doubt, the best movie ever made.  Funny as hell, lots of smokin', drinkin', cussin' and bowlin'.  Donnie, you're out of your element.  Are you employed, sir?  If not, rent this movie immediately and watch it all week. If you do have a job, watch it after work.  Haven't you heard?  Your war is over, Mr. Lebowski! The bums lost!  Well, I've had enough of this movie review.  Mind if I do a J?

It is easy to forget that The Big Lebowski is a mystery, like the Coen brothers' previous hit, Fargo. Where Fargo is dark, The Big Lebowski is a parody. Hidden in the jokes, satire, idiosyncratic characters, and musical numbers, the story is about a hippie "bum," geniusly portrayed by Jeff Bridges, who is unwittingly sucked into becoming a pawn in kidnapping and embezzling scams. As the narrator, The Stranger (Sam Eliot) roundaboutly puts it, "Sometimes there's a man--I won't say a hee-ro, 'cause what's a hee-ro?--but sometimes there's a man. And I'm talking' about the Dude here--sometimes there's a man who, wal, he's the man for his time'n place, he fits right in there--and that's the Dude" (The Big Lebowski). In some ways a monomyth, The Dude takes us on an anti-hero's journey. The Dude's legal name happens to be the same as a bigwig whose trophy bride and former porn star, Bunny (Tara Reed), owes money to a porn producer, Jackie Treehorn. The producer's goons confuse the two Jeffrey Lebowskis and micturate on the Dude's room-tying-together rug. This sets off a chain of events that begins with The Dude seeking reparations from the Big Lebowski (David Huddleston) on the advice of his bowling buddies Walter Sobchak (John Goodman) and Donny Kerabatsos (Steve Buscemi). This leads into him becoming the wealthier Lebowski's patsy in his plot to embezzle funds from his wife's foundation, because the Big Lebowski replaces his wife's ransom money with a ringer, intending to frame The Dude for its loss. The Dude ultimately and unwittingly undermines the scheme by solving the mystery after determining that they had "replaced the ringer with a ringer." He further subverts The Big Lebowski by knocking up his only daughter, Maude (Julianne Moore). A major theme of The Big Lebowski is masculinity, its stereotypes, and their deconstruction. The Big Lebowski analyzes his masculinity, asking The Dude, "What makes a man? Is it. . . is it, being prepared to do the right thing? Whatever the price? Isn't that what makes a man?" To which, The Dude quips, "Sure, that and a pair of testicles." The motif of masculine stereotypes is repeated throughout the film and each character the Dude encounters on his journey is a different stereotype, even caricature, of manliness, most of which are expertly subverted. Jeffrey "The Big" Lebowski appears wealthy and powerful, but is physically confined to a wheelchair and we learn that the money belonged to his wife and is wrapped up in a charitable foundation, so he actually has relatively little control. His bark is significantly worse than his bite. Brant (Phillip Seymour Hoffman) is educated with what is potentially a high-powered position, yet is a sycophantic flunky. You can almost see his tail tucked between his legs. Walter is a trigger-happy, ultra-militaristic war hero, stuck in the Vietnam era. He destroys a shiny, new Corvette with a baseball bat while shouting, "This is what you get when you f*** a stranger in the ass." The Jesus is a hyper-sexualized, pederast, who literally licks a ball during his introduction. The Stranger is a Cowboy. Jackie Treehorn is a wealthy pornographer, surrounded by scantily-clad women. Karl Hungus/Dieter/Lead Nihilist is Bunny's porn costar, and his fellow nihilists/pretend-nappers are over-the-top aggressive and obsessively attempting to castrate The Dude. The only two female characters are also a mishmash of stereotypes. Bunny is a porn star, trophy wife, farm girl, and runaway. Maude is a privileged, educated, feminist and creator of "strongly vaginal" artwork. She tests The Dude's masculinity by saying "vagina" and several synonyms in an attempt to unnerve him.

A rare treat lies within TBL, The coen's deliver a witty, smart and at times political; but it is the mix of their chosen language which all the characters in all their films share, added with brilliant acting TBL will remain a memorable and special film. If you lack knowledge of the 'Fargo' makers or have yet to see a film by the Coen i worn not to approach TBL due to it's different but outstanding way of delivering a story, from the cool camera Angles to the unexpected but valid ending. TBL will stick with the viewer in mind for days and in heart for its characters (The Dude et al), dialogue, monologues, direction, originality and it's one and only story.I hope that the Coens remain in the High class because every film i have seen of theirs i have loved. So Raise a "White Russian" to the creators and enjoy an Unique, unpredictable and unforgettable film.----Cheers Coens!

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies of all time.
reviews.content: Jeff Lebowski (or 'the Dude', as he prefers to be called) is an aging hippy who loses his favorite rug when he is mistaken for a millionaire with the same name. The Dude and his loudmouthed friend Walter find themselves in a sometimes surreal, always hilarious series of adventures. They encounter eccentric characters and sometimes-bizarre situations in their attempts to stop a kidnapping that may or may not have happened, evade Germans who may be Nazis or Nihilists, but who are probably just a former techno-pop band, and maybe even get the Dude's rug back. The dialogue is hilarious, and the cast is fantastic. The Big Lebowski is one of those movies that gets better with repeat viewings. It was written and directed by the Coen brothers and stars Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi, John Turturro, Philip Seymour Hoffman, many others, and Flea! Highly Recommended!

reviews.review_title: The best film ever about just being a dude...
reviews.content: The Coen Brothers hit gold (again) with this film, the best film ever about just being a dude. Jeff Bridges is superb in his Peter Smith-like portrait of an everyday Californian joe who suddenly finds himself embroiled in a world of kidnap, extortion and violence after a group of germans break into his house, mistake him for a millionaire, and soil his carpet. Heck, he's just the Dude. Bridges recently admitted that whenever he catches this film on TV he finds it hard to switch over. It's easy to see why. Like all the Coens best films, this is a  multi-layered work with memorable characters, effective cameos, the usual strangeness, quotable lines (some of the best) and some very very funny scenes. Original and definitely one to catch, again and again...

This is a movie that (for me) can be watched over and over and over again and still find tiny details that you never noticed before. This and Fargo are my favorite Coen brother movies because of the environment around them affects the story. Now I know you can say the same thing about other Coen brother film or any film for that matter, but for me the snowy wasteland of Fargo, North Dakota and the suburban by day neon by night oasis of Los Angeles really make the films what they are (and in my perspective masterpieces!). Jeff Bridges famously plays his role to near perfection and in my opinion makes all of his other roles obsolete. This means whenever I see him in another movie as a different Character I only see him as the iconic role that he nailed in 1988. The Big Lebowski is my favorite movie and I recommend to anyone and everyone

reviews.review_title: A guy called the dude is forced from his daily routine to go on a hunt for a new rug.
reviews.content: I loved this movie, loved it.Mind you, it doesn't seem many critics liked it that much. I can think of many reasons why, one is that I have bad taste, and the other is that they are so anal that they missed the entire point of the movie.I've heard the plot sucks, well, i've watched this several times, and I have yet to even notice the plot. The plot isn't the point, this movies point is the dude.Want me to sum up the plot?-A guy called the dude is forced from his daily routine to go on a hunt for a new rug.And thats about it, thats what drives the dude. When faced with the prospect of getting several thousand dollars, he remains concerned only with his rug. Getting serveral thousand dollars might force a change in his lifestyle after all, something he tries desperatly to get back throughout the course of this movie.This movie is looked at mostly from the point of view of the dude, as such, you see the world through his eyes. A bunch of events stopping him from getting a new rug. Jeff Bridges plays the part perfectly, out of place and annoyed by everything around him taking up his bowling time.I found the entire movie hilarious in a typical over done coen way, nothing anyone says is predictable, its very well acted, well paced, and well shot (of course).Just sit back and relax, don't look to hard, and enjoy the situations the dude ends up in because everyone around him refuses to adopt his life style. Whats the moral message of the movie? I dunno, who cares?

I love so many of the actors in this film and was really looking forward to seeing The Big Lebowski for the first time.After just watching it with such great expectations, I'm left seriously wondering what the heck is wrong with people? 
This movie was a waste of an amazing cast. This movie goes absolutely no where and is just a bunch of random, ridiculous, incoherent and implausible scenarios lazily strung together on a weak gimmick of a storyline. I really wanted to like this movie but it was just awful.

reviews.review_title: The movie that defines La-La Land
reviews.content: Whenever I am far away from LA, longing for home, I pop this DVD into my player and enjoy one of the funniest, most enjoyably bizzare films I have ever seen. Along with Steve Martin's brilliant "LA Story" this stands as one of movies that captures the quirky, often times nonsensical aspects of living in Los Angeles (particularly if you live from Hollywood west towards Venice Beach). I really don't want to ruin the film by going into the plot, instead I will assure that it (A) captures the LA mystique and (B) is highly entertaining.

"The Big Lebowski" is easily a modern classic. It is so under appreciated it's sick. This movie rules! Every scene is funny and needs to seen again and again. This movie has everything;-Amazing characters achieved by actors at the top of their game.
-Great directing, including mind spinning dream sequences.
-Incredible music that meshes perfectly with the action.
-Sex-Drugs-Drinking-Violence-BowlingIf you like funny movies, I highly recommend this one. If you like detective movies, you will appreciate this film. If you like Chandler novels, you will LOVE this film.Do yourself a favor and go out and buy this modern classic. You won't believe how much you enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: There IS a point to all this.
reviews.content: OK, Here goes. (Some minor spoilers).Although I have been an IMDb enthusiast/member for quite some time, I do not usually write comments or reviews here (this is my first), but was moved to do so after seeing The Big Lebowski for the second time. I first saw it around 2 years ago.It is pointless to re-iterate the comments of many other reviewers that this movie is simply great : Great movie, comedy, acting, directing etc. I agree wholeheartedly (See previous reviews for the merits of this movie). However, having watched the Dude again recently I thought I would attempt to add something new to previous reviews.Is their a point or message to this movie? Well, for what it is worth ; here is my offering. It could be said that the main theme of the film is social or moral responsibility. We all have our faults, yet we constantly criticize others while ignoring our own. We have the Dude and Walter being completely disgusted at the thought of someone peeing on the Dude's rug. (And 'out of order' it certainly is. It held the room together, man). Then, very shortly afterward Walter finds it perfectly acceptable to stick a gun in an opponents face for a bowling faux pas. While constantly annoyed and frustrated by his best buddies lack of social and diplomatic skills, The Dude is probably committing the greatest sin of all : Most people consider that dropping out, not working and possessing a completely apathetic attitude to life is just not acceptable. We all think those characters are fun, have great lives and wish we could be them but we just can't. We have jobs, lives, wives, kids.. We then have poor old Donny : Everyone has a voice and a right to be heard but, Walter constantly reminds him that he is out of his depth and forever cuts him off. There are also other comments on the idle rich (Bunny) and the wealthy selfish types who are all consumed with themselves or what they do. Maude wants a child but is not interested in a partner or Father for her intended offspring. Most would consider that to commit a child to a one-parent relationship automatically, even before it is born, is a moral/social wrong.Perhaps these things suggest that we all have a responsibility to the people and issues around us.Then there is the problem of the little green pieces of paper. All morals or responsibility suddenly disappear when there are a million bucks floating around. Walter goes for the throat and decides that nothing is going to stop him and the Dude getting that money. The only thing that makes him think twice is when the Dude suggests that he may not bowl in the team. Even the Dude himself, totally laid back and previously only concerned with getting a new rug, gets caught up in the deceit and subterfuge, eagerly snapping up the chance for finders fees and other financial incentives for finding money that he and his buddy lost in the first place. Fine attitudes all round. In my opinion, this point is finally rammed home by the comically inept nihilist germans. They typify all the previous comments with a complete dis-regard for anyone and everything but themselves and financial or other gain.The responsibility issue then goes further 'up the line' with Walter reminding his buddies, everyone around him and the audience about the Vietnam thing (Echoing not just Vietnam vets, but many other dis-enchanted ex-serviceman worldwide). Socially and morally responsible government anyone ? We are informed that the events take place shortly after the Gulf War. Saddam Hussein even makes an appearance, issuing The Dude with his bowling shoes in the dream sequence. A chilling perspective indeed.Lastly, my favourite scene, which would seem to illustrate the main point. The Dude and Walter are in a coffee shop and are reminded by the owner to watch their manners/language as 'This is a family place'. The Dude wanders off but Walter just sits there. (His attitude and the look on his face are a picture). He is gonna finish his coffee, he ain't doing nothing bad. As he often says 'Am I wrong?'

The only thing that bothers me about this well crafted masterpiece is that the Coens did not get the sufficient praise they so richly deserved.  I am also terrified - I am actually awake at night thinking about this - that John Goodman has no idea how much the public loved and was even staggered by his brilliant performance in this film.This is the funniest movie ever made, period.

reviews.review_title: the plane has crashed into the side of the mountain
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski is an epic film that has "strikes and gutter-balls...ups and downs." The cast is spectacular. There are many stars that appear in this film. Jeff Bridges does a great job playing the wonderfully lazy: The Dude. John Goodman is very funny as high tempered Vietnam vet. And Steve Buscemi's character, Donny, is very funny as the innocent victim of Goodman's temper. I can not picture any other actors playing these characters, or the other characters for that matter. The Big Lebowski has an excellent plot, something that most comedies seem to lack. This is a must see movie that will have you repeating some quotes from the film to your friends on a regular basis. This is one of the funniest films of all time. THE DUDE ABIDES...

Love this movie! Seriously one of the best of all times! If you haven't seen this movie and have been debating it you must I mean must watch! The Cohen brothers are not only genius comedic writers but the way this movie is shot is brilliant as well! Point of view shots colors and slow mos of yeah! This is one of Jeff Daniels and John Goodman best rolls of all time! WATCH THIS MOVIE!!! Several times too because you end up catching a lot the second time around! The comedic timing from Steve Buschmi of my Gard! And John Tortoro as Jesus well need I mention that this is one of his best rolls as well! Everyone in the family (except for the under 14 age group because there is nudity) will enjoy this movie. It really did take me a couple times of watching it though to really get how brilliant it is!

I love most to all Coen movies but anyone who believes this is not their best work is just wrong. I realize that is just like my opinion man but I defy you to find a more quotable movie, with more entertaining characters anywhere. Mark it an 8, or better, or you are just over the line! I am down with Fargo, which seems to be the other popular fan favorite for the Coens, but it is still 4th best at best. Big Lebowski is clear cut #1 Hudsucker Proxy is arguable #2 3rd could be: Raising Arizona, Blood Simple, or Miller's Crossing 4th: Fargo comes in ahead of O' Brother and Intolerbale Cruelty...barely. Grab some caucasians, sit back, and reevaluate the Dude, for your own good.

Before I watched this film I was a high flying business man working in London. A mover and shaker, a big wig you know the type. I brought and destroyed people like you before lunch time just for kicks, but that all changed. On one of my rare moments off, I managed to slow down enough to watch this film. And let me say this I am a changed man. Instead of going to work and holding meetings with people all over the world, I just walk around in my pants all day drinking White Russians and touching myself. Oh and there's some bowling involved as well. Pay close attention to my story, for we all need to slow down. Instead of working have a drink, or go bowling. Or what ever you want I don't give a crap what you do!!!

I'll be honest : I adore this movie , however I find that it is not for everyone . If you are looking for a traditional comedy this is not it . The thing that this comedy has are colorful and creative flairs unlike any another . First off , the story is about a mid-aged hippie "the dude" who is mistaken to be a millionaire by two goons . They claim "the Dude" owes them money and subsequently urinate on his rug . Later on "The dude" goes to the millionaire and complains about the urinated rug . This is where the story unfolds to be a fusion of hippie culture , odd personalities and funny twists - resulting to be a creative perfection . I give the Coen brothers props for creating such well thought characters and having them creatively adjust to the entourage . As for the acting , I would say that Bridges and Goodman were perfect . This movie is a must for all you folks who love nontraditional comedies .

reviews.review_title: All moments of this movie - masterpiece, in some sense...
reviews.content:
The best comedy of all the time.
Only a person with real talent can do film without sance so interested. And Coen's
have enough talent, do not think you will argue.
This film leaves a very strange feeling. But only possitive.
I can't recomendet this movie to all my friends, even he is the best I ever seen.
Not all can understand that and I don't think that I do.
10/10

One of the best comedies I've ever seen in my entire life and definitely one of my favorite films ever. It figures... we are talking about two writers that produce gold every time their pens touch paper and about a truly incredible cast! The story is absurd and brilliant, but the real strong point of this movie are the characters: The Dude (Jeff Bridges), Walter (John Goodman), Donny (Steve Buscemi), Maude (Julian Moore) and of course Jesus (John Torturo), five of the many in this film, really rare types of persons that produce some masterpiece acting from all actors, stars or not... The movie is full of out of the normal situations that watching them will make you laugh your heart out and amazingly intelligent lines!Definitely a very special film, you're going to laugh really really hard and you'll never forget it...
I don't know what I just watched, but I had fun watching it.

The Coen Brothers created cult followings worldwide when they released this 1998 film noir comedic classic. This movie features stellar performances from both Jeff Bridges and John Goodman as the laid back "The Dude" Lebowski and the angry Vietnam veteran Walter who go on a quest to seek compensation for The Dude's urinated stained rug and get caught up in a unusual mystery. In addition to a hilarious script, it features a eclectic soundtrack of the likes of Bob Dylan, Captain Beefheart and Creedence Clearwater Revival which fits the mood of the movie. After seeing this movie, I would now put this film amongst my favorites and recommended that everybody see it. The dude abides....

reviews.review_title: A nice ride but at times too ridiculous
reviews.content: Like Fargo, The Coen brothers have decided too add the same spirit to "The Big Lebowski". I certainly think this works as the whole motive of the protagonist is to retrieve his carpet, which is something ridiculous. Yet this idea still works very well and is very entertaining because of the great pacing, aesthetic and spirit of the film.In the film we follow Jeffrey Lebowski (Jeff Bridges) known as "The Dude". Beacuse of the great production design, costume design and directing, as well as the spot on acting from Jeff Bridges, we get the impression that The Dude is living a life where he does not really care about much. However he cares deeply for his carpet that got ruined because of two debt collectors who mistook him for a different Lebowski. The Dude then later goes on to try to get a new carpet/money for a carpet by finding the other Lebowskis wife. This goes wrong and the rest of the movie than follows The Dude and his friend trying to fix this up. The film has suspense, comedy and an interesting plot, however it sometimes becomes too ridiculous. I personally thought the "dreams" The Dude was having while he was doped were a little out of place/unnecessary. Because the film already follows a comedic plot, and the films spirit is at the same level, these shots I found were personally too much. With that being said I found the film entertaining and a fun ride to watch. The Coen brothers certainly are great storytellers.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest films of the '90s
reviews.content: It is difficult to define one genre for this masterpiece:Coen Brothers combine comedy with various elements of the noir movies, such as the abundance of characters linked to each other through secret ties that reveal the rottenness behind everyone.Our protagonist is not the usual policeman or private investigator damned and alcoholic, but a complete idler,Jeffrey Lebowski(interpreted by Jeff Bridges) who will be meddled in a case of alleged kidnapping. The film is set in Los Angeles in the early 1990s, with characters well-outlined and marked by a story behind, many of which are just victims of events that live or are forced to live.The Jeffrey Lebowski characterization is gorgeous: a middle-aged lover of bowling and white Russian (this movie will make you want to drink one immediately!),in which there is a great influence of Taoist philosophy.Jeffrey abides all the events that come to him, staying calm and never getting angry.Just like a Taoist sage, he does practically nothing to change his situation. He never takes position in doing something, he always finds himself victim of the events.The protagonist is joined by Walter (played by John Goodman), representing Jeffrey's complete opposite: this character is in fact presumptuous and violent; he is angry at all (the scene where he threatens to shoot an acquaintance only because he broke a rule of Bowling is awesome) and takes the situation in hand, turning it completely.The contrast between the two is functional: like the yin and the yang, the two friends complement each other creating a balance between disorder and order, activity and passivity.Photography and direction are sublime, the only opening scene is worth more than whole films. The Coen brothers manage to focus the attention of the spectator on objects and minutia, even with mute shots and without giving much explanation. Salient points are then highlighted by the scenes in which the protagonist is out of his own (as when it is hit in the head) in which his subconscious frees up and transforms Jeffrey's desires and thoughts into true images. In the visions are actually present the bowling, carpet and daughter of the homonym Mr Lebowski dressed as a Valkyrie (surely to mark the nationality of the nihilists with whom she had to do).The soundtrack is very good for the film, so it is connected to Lebowski as much as his dressing gown and cocktails.End up finally recommending this movie to anyone: that you love the investigative films or the comedies you can not do without this movie! You can see it with your family in cheerfulness and tranquility, or have a thorough insight into the Freudian nature of visions and the well-delineated philosophy of the characters and still enjoy this masterpiece, which would definitely be seen at least once in life.

This, in my opinion, is quite possibly one of the best films of all time. With an all star cast including Steve Buscemi, Jeff Bridges, and Jon Goodman. These men were born to play these roles! They go on and on about almost anything. Very strong and well thought out characters. Turturro is another favorite of mine, portraying the character Jesus in this story. The movie flows well, and in the end it concludes that even the biggest losers in the world can make a difference. Having watched this movie over 500 times now I could go on about it for days, but this is a must see for anyone! It is my life dream to meet the dude in person, he is an actual person according to the Coens. Only the Coen brothers could make a two hour work of art on such a random series of events! amazing, 10!!!

This film is completely excellent.  In addition to the wonderful acting and scenes mentioned by everyone else, how about:  the landlord?  the landlord's pathetic interpretive dance?  and Walter (Goodman) showing up at the landlord's pathetic interpretive dance wearing a COAT and TIE because, by God, that's the proper thing to do - when you go to a cultural event you dress for the occasion, AM I RIGHT?And don't forget the cameo appearance by the greatest hamburger in the world:  In and Out!

My new all-time fave flick.  A meandering plot - if you can call it  plot (a bit like being stoned and forgetting what you were going to say next - then just changing the subject completely)- but it doesn't matter!  All the characters are perfect - even though we don't see much of Turturro and Buscemi.  Jeff Bridges is superb - and looking VERY good.  The Dialogue and scenes make it a cult classic - and it didn't even make it to my local cinema!

reviews.review_title: Don't waste two hours of your life!
reviews.content: This was the worst movie I've seen in years and days. A film without plot and with tiresome characters that for some inexplicable reason repeat themselves endlessly. Issuing warning for this oil. Those of you who want to see a twisted film with a 60s feel would rather watch an original film from this decade. No, not even actors of this film's caliber can save such an embarrassing attempt to profit from the nostalgia of the 60s. I watched it to the end to see if it could somehow save the movie. But it just got worse and worse with an anticlimax at the end. Don't waste two hours of your life. As I did!

Now, I know people have complained about this film stating it was stupid and that it didn't make any sense...well, I'll speak for myself, I loved it! The Coen Bros. are the best filmakers of our time and this was no exception. Jeff Bridges was superb as the "Dude" and surprised me with his transformation into a slacker. John Goodman, Steve Buscemi and John Turturro(all Coen vets) put in memorable roles and made the film that much better! Watch for Jon Polito as the private detective following the "Dude", he was also in Miller's Crossing and Barton Fink.A word of advice, if you loved Fargo, do not expect a sequel, you'll be very disappointed. Expect the unexpected and enjoy it for what it is, a very funny comedy.
I think this movie is as funny as "Raising Arizona" and to me it is much more relevant to the average person than "Fargo" was. I recommend this movie to all those who don't listen to the hype.

reviews.review_title: Jelly shoes can be worn by just one man, the dude.
reviews.content: I hadn't heard much about this film, but it was recommended to me highly, so I rented it out from the video shop and couldn't bring myself to take it back the next day, or the day after that for that matter, amounting to a couple of days worth of fines, but what the hey, it was worth it. From the very beginning when the China man pees on his rug, I knew I was in for a cracker, and I was right. The characters are excellent, the lines are sharp and funny, but best of all as the narrator claimed, it is a really cool story.This is my film of the year, yes I know it was released last year and I know its only february, but it's that good, watch it now, before I send the China man 'round to pee on your rug!

How cool is this movie !!!! Dude........ it's way cool. Caught this movie in London the first time, then saw it in New York the second time, now its on cable in OZ !!!!! A great cast with a good story and brilliant direction.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies ever made!!
reviews.content: Only from the makers of Fargo could a movie such as this be made. A jewel of a film full of great performances, and one of the wackiest, wildest plots ever written. A great ride, funny, and (believe it or not)extremely intelligent. John Goodman at his best as the Vietnam Vet with a screw loose!! Jeff Bridges makes post-60s hippy life look great too!

When I first sat down to watch The Big Lebowski, I looked around and thought, hey where am I. Who is that strange man on the floor? Then I turned on the movie. As you can tell I enjoyed the movie, but had trouble seeing it considering I was recently maced.The Dude (Bridges), so he is called by his friends, is an obvious sociopath. He has little to no regard for any life especially his own. The Dude should come hang out with me and my friends so we can share some white russians.Walter (Goodman) is the best foil character for the Dude.The best part of the film was played by Buscemi. He played Donnie. Donnie will be sorely missed.

reviews.review_title: one of the funniest movies EVER
reviews.content: If you haven't seen this movie, see it in the near future...never, and i do mean never has a movie been more of a "cognitive" comedy. By this I mean, it isn't a no brainer like "tommy boy" or "the mask".  those don't even rank near "the big lebowski".  "TBL" makes you think about the different types of people that have surfaced as a result of our new society (the new age) and what happens when you throw them, and a million dollars, together. The "dude" is excellently portrayed by Jeff Bridges. He's a laid back, unemployed, joint smoking bowler.  That's who he is.  All throughout the movie he tends to pick up other peoples lines and use them, instead of his own...("this aggression will not stand" and "to use the parlence of our times" strike me right off the bat)and so in many ways, he is representative of the average. the other, complimentary characters, are by no means less important, or for that matter, less funny.  walter sobjac is one of the funniest characters you will find in any movie ("shomer f***ing shobbas") in conclusion, see the movie, you'll laugh and laugh again

Of the Coen Brothers' works, I must say that this and Raising Arizona are, without a doubt, my favorites.  They never back off of saying or doing something that is not just shocking or provoking (ala' Farrelly Brothers), rather they show something that is simply perversely funny, and for this reason, I will never grow tired of their films.Lebowski is held up by a strong cast of Coen Brothers regulars, including the timeless Buscemi, Stormare, Goodman, and Turturro, all extremely skilled in their trade.And behind it all, if you look very very very closely, you'll find a moral. It's a theme throughout the movie, so it won't stick out in any particular part.Most of all, it's a fun romp through those carefree days where nothing really matters.  Watch this with friends.  Watch this with other Coen Brothers fans.  Keep on laughing.  It's a good movie, and I hope you enjoy it as much as I have and continue to do.

reviews.review_title: The Human Races finest artistic achievement
reviews.content: Sha la la   la la la  la la Sha la la   la la la  la la Sha la la   la la la  la la  lalala la la   la laThe man in me will do nearly any task But as for compensation there is a little he would askFantastic!  My favorite movie for sure.  Please everyone go rent it - but, just a fair warning, it took me maybe 2-3 or more times through it to really appreciate all the language and detail that make it so artistic and hilarious.I'm talking about drawing a line in the sand here dude.. ACROSS THIS LINE - YOU DO NOT Also dude...

reviews.review_title: It's one of a handful of comedies that gets funnier each time.
reviews.content: It's one of the few comedies that gets funnier each time you watch it. I just saw it again a few nights ago and laughed out loud at least a dozen times. It has so many qualities that you look for in being able to watch a movie more than once (memorable lines- "Hey man there's a beverage involved here!" great characters- when will I see a movie about Jesus the bowling freak and an interesting plot- too involved to mention)The performances by Jeff Bridges and John Goodman are just incredible, I could remember after I saw it the first time I wanted to become the Dude. Steve Buscemi is also great in a more relaxed comedic role opposed to his normal freaky type characters. Very original and funny.

This is one hell of a film.  I first saw it in the theatre as a preview (my teacher at the time often gave us free passes!!) before I had heard any bad press about it.  I was so confused the first time, and wondering what was this about, that it made me want to see it again.  That is when I know that I am going to like a movie, when i want to see it again.  The main character, The Dude (Or El dudarino if you are not into the whole brevity thing) is quite simply the laziest person in the world.  The Dude, whose life revolves around drinking White Russians (Which I now drink mostly because of the movie, and mostly cause I like um!) and smoking grass while driving and listening to some Creedence, is "taking it easy for all us sinners".  The plot revolves around him, and how his soiled rug gets him into a fandangle that no one could expect.  The movie does so much with so little, kind of in a Seinfeld "show about nothing" type of deal.  But what makes this movie a 10 is the superb acting!!  What a cast, Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, Jullianne Moore, and of course the gorgeous Tara Reid.  This movie has so many intense conversations, that you could practically watch it with just the sound on, and still laugh your ass off. Please, ignore what anyone says, and watch this film, and then watch it again, cause it gets funnier every time!

I have wanted to see this film for ages on the strength of other reviews; not so much from the content of the movie but simply that it was always very highly recommended.I can now see why. This is such a funny and enjoyable film, and one that I cannot wait to see again. I am not into long reviews .. does anyone read them? ..... all I will say is that I have never seen Jeff Bridges and John Goodman give better performances.I love films that have great characters in them, and "the dude" himself is one of the best.

This might not be the best movie you have ever seen. The first time you see it, you probably will not love it, but after you see it a couple of times and start thinking back on it, it becomes a favorite. The characters really jump out at you, even the non-main ones.

reviews.review_title: Extremely well done! I hated it!
reviews.content: If you like intellectual, slightly surreal, slightly more subtle and sophisticated humor than slapstick, then I recommend you try this.  The characters were flawlessly done and the timing was perfect.  There was no predictability I could detect.  This movie has so much of what Hollywood is good at and so little of what is infamous for. Unfortunately, I prefer more in-your-face humor, so I didn't find it funny... but I enjoyed seeing how well put-together and perfectly executed this film is.  If you are even slightly into this type of humor, then this is a film that you will enjoy watching over and over.

reviews.review_title: I hate the f***ing Eagles too ...
reviews.content: ... but I dig Credence, just like the Dude.  Actually, I've known two Dudes, and a Walter and a Donnie.  Could have been the Dude myself if I didn't have a family.  Every character's quirk in this movie rang true to somewhere in my past, except the chicano sex pervert Jesus with his purple jumpsuit, bowling ball in hand,  strutting on the lanes, never seen that before. I've seen this movie more than ten times and loved it each time, not so much for the story as the way the Dude moves smoothly through it, while Walter always makes things more difficult for him thru harsh rashness.  It's odd that two guys so different, such contrasts in style and substance, would be friends, connected only by bowling.  Add some outlandish contrivances and you got max eccentricity. Great music, dream sequences, acting (I think Jeff really is a dude, that he wasn't really acting.) Top Ten movie for me because I love the humor

reviews.review_title: This is intelligent comedy at its best.
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski is one of those rare movies that is still funny after watching it a dozen times.  It is so hard to make good comedy that is even funny the first time through, but the quirkiness of the characters in this film and the brilliant dialogue create a world and story with depth and style.  The writing has a strength to it, reminiscent of The Princess Bride (albeit with slightly more profanity) and Pulp Fiction.

reviews.review_title: Ksam44's 10 rating of The Big Lebowski
reviews.content: A hilarious movie!! A treat for fans of the Coen Brothers. Jeff Bridges and John Goodman are great especially when they are interacting in scenes together. Just one small complaint: Steve Buscemi's role is to small, other then that this film gets a 10 in my book!

reviews.review_title: In the parlance of our times...
reviews.content: I haven't stopped watching this movie since I first saw it about 2 months ago. I guess by reading some of the other user comments that this is the kind of movie that you either love or hate - and I love it!The story is fantastic. The running theme isn't particularly complex but it doesn't need to be. It puts the incredibly laid-back Dude in a series of outrageous situations that no stoner should ever be exposed to! I guess the funniest thing about the movie is that I know a guy who could be evenly compared with the dude and I suppose I'm not the only one - haven't most of us known (or been) a lazy stoner at some point? The story is perpetually fuelled with a line of eccentric characters, all quite different from the dude in personality and lifestyle. The Dude's interactions with them in his quest to obtain a replacement rug are hilarious (especially with the Malibu Chief of Police!!).Julianne Moore is fantastic as the artist/feminist millionaire. The line she delivers to Dude while Bunny's porn film is running is a classic: "The story is ludicrous" she says with disdain, viewing the porn flick with her critical eye (post-irony at its best!).I did think that the inclusion of Sam Elliot was a needless one. Essentially the story didn't require the 'insight' of a narrative and although I appreciate the comic value of his inclusion, perhaps he might have been better utilised on another project?Essentially, and I think this is the case with more than one of the Coen Brother's films, is that the dialogue is excellent - it is nearly always the way the lines are delivered that makes the scenes so funny, not the actual lines themselves. This is true for many different characters in this movie, from the Big Lebowski himself to the Chief of Malibu Police (who's scene with the Dude is comedy genius).Anyway, I can't knock it - I love the movie, "His Dudeness" is one of the funniest/best characters I have ever seen and I cannot recommend this movie enough...particularly if you're a middle aged, jobless stoner...I'm not, by the way...middle aged that is!

Could you imagine anyone taking care to check the "contains spoilers" box before submitting a comment on this movie. The joys of this movie have so little to do with plot revelations that checking that box would be superfluous even if the comment did reveal spoilers. This is the Cohen brothers best movie. I will make a bold prediction: In twenty years, Fargo will have receded into the shadows of forgotten but once praised films, while The Big Lebowski will still be providing its own unique version of wit and humour to film lovers who appreciate the kind of comedy that comes out of funny characters and organic natural feeling dialogue.

Its a comedic master piece with memorable characters none which are stagnant or boring.Every one is quirky,weird,funny or strange and definitely interesting.The movie just flows,one never notices the time.Its a comedy caper with unusual plot turns and makes the movie very spontaneous.Its a fun-film,take a break and watch it or watch it to take a break.Not writing 10 lines gives away nothing in this case and with no spoilers one can enjoy the movie as it was meant to be as a great director/actor once said.One only needs to know about a movie if he is looking for certain things funny or thriller or romance??This is just a chill out movie,go in with no expectations not even the funny parts,expecting a joke ruins the laugh.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious one-liners, and an enveloping plot.
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski is, contrary to critical opinion, the best of the Coen Brothers' movies. It seems that every line has been crafted with the keenest of eyes for hilarity. Every word out of almost every character's mouth is funny. Bridges is genius as the slacker-bum, John Goodman is extremely entertaining as the put-upon, aggressive Vietnam vet. You'll be quoting Jesus Quintana (John Turturro) for weeks after the movie.If you like intelligent humor, a plot that will keep you guessing, and movies you'll be sorting out for weeks after viewing, you'll LOVE The Big Lebowski!

reviews.review_title: whats the deal with sam elliot
reviews.content: it seems to me that most people who do not like the big lebowski have only seen it once, i hated after the first time i saw it, but then i saw it again and cant stop watching it, i had to go out and buy it the next day, ive been trying to figure out what its all about, cause it seems to portray itself as really being about nothing but there are all these different characters that portray different ideologies and perspectives, like nihilism or feminism or capitalism or fascism, pacifism especially, the list goes on, the movie seems to be about the struggle of these different ideologies during a time of war that no one seems to care about, i know everyone says jeff bridges does a good job but personally i think john goodman does one of the best acting jobs ive ever seen, of which the writing has a lot to do with, the only thing i have no idea whatsoever that belongs in this movie is sam elliot, am i wrong? i mean who drinks sasperilla anyway? haha, but i do highly recommend this movie one of the few films i can watch over and over and enjoy more every time

This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen. Smart, clever, and very well acted. Very refreshing. Thank God for Joel and Ethan Coen. Jeff Bridges is absolutely hilarious as the Dude, and John Goodman... what can I say? Priceless. Philip Seymour Hoffman made me laugh so hard, and I don't think he was supposed to. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: A different comedy. MUST BE SEEN.
reviews.content: I love this film ! I own the video and have seen it 4 times. A different comedy. I recommend it to everybody who hasn´t seen it. The characters play excelent. Especially John Goodman. As said before: A must see !

Dead funny, hilarious, intelligent and absolutely original. The acting (especially John Goodman) is first rate and the Coen brothers seem to have the time of their life. No deeper thoughts here, just entertainment for a demanding audience.

reviews.review_title: For time killing The Big Lebowski is the one of the best movies
reviews.content: This movie is certainly original . Yes that is the perfect word to describe that movie. I watched 3 times , never love it but I didn't get bored during the movie at all . I don't know if I may watch this movie again or not. But it is certainly an original movie. While watching this movie your face is in the same shape , never laugh hard, don't get upset or anything. Your face will be in the same form at the beginning of the movie and when it ends. If you have time and don't know what to watch it is a good choice. But it won't be your favorite movie ever ...After that movie I realized that laziness is maybe a very smart choice to really enjoying the life.

reviews.review_title: My Favorite Movie. Go rent it.
reviews.content: There are so many things that I like about this movie.  First of all, I don't think there is another movie that has so many great quotes in it, not to mention that every character in the movie has their share of great quotes.  If you are looking for a movie to quote, look no further.Second, The Dude has the coolest style.  A guy obviously stuck in the Sixties, he carelessly and effortlessly slides through life without a job and has the best time at it.  A kind-hearted, innocent guy, he loves to bowl, get high, and listen to Bob Dylan.Third, the plot of this movie is excellent.  Dont be mis-led, there is very little apparent plot.  However, there is very much going on that is unsaid which makes the movie very complex and intricate.  To understand the motivations of the individual characters takes some concentration.  It took me many times of watching it to fully understand what each character had going on in his/her head.Fourth, the dialog is highly developed.  The conversations in this movie are so unlike most movies.  The characters continuously interrupt each other, change subjects, lose their train of thought, etc.  Such a refreshing departure from the cookie cutter Hollywood film.  But yes, there is an unusually high amount of obscenities.  However, this movie does not attempt to sugar-coat the vocabulary of real people, they keep it true-to-life.As with most of the other Coen brothers' movies, the underlying theme is this:  Something bad or illegal happens, and instead of the onlookers trying to help the victims, they decide to try to make a personal gain from the situation.A masterpiece!  10 out of 10.  Now go out and watch it.

How good is this film? I may be out of my element here, but I have to say it must be one of the finest movies ever made! It is so funny, so clever and so absolutely, stupefyingly brilliant. Given the habits of John Goodman and Steve Buscemi (best actor in hollywood-no question!) to steal every movie they are in, I didn't think it would work but I was proved wrong. This movie rules!

reviews.review_title: Funniest movie I have ever seen!
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski, the funniest movie I have ever seen, is based around the life of "The Dude."  A parasite on society, who has only one life concern, bowling.  Played by Jeff Bridges, he embarks on a strange journey after Wu(the Chinaman) p****d on his rug that "tied the room together."  With the attempted help of his friend, bowling partner, and Vietnam vet, Walter(played by John Goodman), they try to solve the mystery of "where the f**k is the money?"  A must see for anybody who enjoys sarcasm and real humor, not some gimmick.

reviews.review_title: Personal Opinions Are Laid To Rest
reviews.content: "The Dude abides", and rightfully so.  With their greatest piece of work yet, the Coen Brothers have created a masterpiece with "The Big Lebowski". Whether consciously or subconsciously the Coen's have painted the most life like picture of Hollywood that has ever been seen by the naked eye.  Raw, honest, and most of all hilarious "The Big Lebowski" tells the story of three good friends who's lives revolve around bowling.  Even when one of them, "The Dude" (Jeff Bridges), gets caught up in a case of mistaken identity they still focus on the bowling league.  This isn't all folks, HA! Anyone with half a brain will laugh at this movie, although anyone with the other half still in tact will surely see that even from Sam Elliot's opening monologue this entire film spoofs the hollywood process.  Regardless of whether you recognize this or not, personal opinions are laid to rest with this film.  It has been said that every individual has an individual personality but along with the dawn of this beautiful new Coen Brothers film is also the realization that there is not one person on this green old earth that can make it through "The Big Lebowski" without laughing.  It is packed so tight with jokes that it'll make your grandadie's constipation look like a piece of cake.  If you don't like this film or rate it anywhere below a 7 that is fine, for at that point of clicking the "vote" button with 7 or below you shall finally find that you are indeed retarded.  Proceed to the doctor's immediately for treatment, because if you rate this film 7 or below you are in need of medical attention.  Personal opinions are laid to rest!

reviews.review_title: More overrated soul-less slop from the Coen brothers
reviews.content: It started ok - Jeff Bridges is usually quite easy to like in a movie - but I soon get bored. The main reason is because, like other Coen brothers films, the characters are fairly empty and void of humanity, and you just end up not caring about them, and subsequently not caring about what happens to them. I rented this on video - the case said "in a perfect world, all movies would be made by the coen brothers". I think this is a *little* overrated. In a perfect world, NO movies would be made by the Coen brothers :)

Its very hard to release a completely original movie and it be worth watching.  EXAMPLE:  Natural Born Killers.  NOT WORTH WATCHING...but yet completely original. The Big Lebowski is one of the best Coen Brothers movies.  The best being O Brother Where Art Thou?  I am not a big fan of Fargo.  I like my movies good.  Fargo wasnt. Anyways, The Big Lebowski is about american's other favorite past time...BOWLING, and a few bums who play it. Jeff Bridges proves he is an awesome actor in this movie playing 'The Dude.' Only a great actor can play a character like 'The Dude' and then a few years later get an Academy Award nomination for playing the President of the United States in 'The Contender.' The dream sequences in this movie are the funniest I have seen since 'National Lampoons European Vacation.' This movie rocked!

reviews.review_title: What a monumental waste of time.
reviews.content: I would love to have the 2 hours of my life back that I spent watching this stupid movie. Seeing the really high reviews, I decided to watch it. After about a half hour, I didn't like it, but sometimes movies take a while to get going, and the payoff might be at the end. An hour into it, it's not any better, but I figure I'm halfway through, so I might as well finish it, just in case it somehow redeems itself. That never happened, and it continued to be crap the entire time. I would say that if you watch this and don't like it after 30 minutes, just stop and go do something else, because it's not going to get any better.I've seen all these reviews from other people talking about what a great film this is, and I just don't get it. I'm reasonably intelligent, and I'm generally pretty easily entertained, but this movie was just dumb. Dumb, dumb, and dumb. Besides that, it's also stupid. I'd definitely like those two hours of my life back.

By far the best Coen Brothers film,once you watch this,you will wish The Dude was your buddy,watch it at least twice,there is so much funny dialouge,the interaction between Dude,Walter and Donny especially.Never has there been a film with so much great characters,you will also realise that life should be like it is in the Dudes world,dont set your sights too high,just take life as it comes,even with all the stuff that comes his way.

reviews.review_title: If you've seen it once, watch it again!
reviews.content: I checked this site and couldn't believe the low rating that this film received.  I know you're thinking that 7.8 isn't particularly poor, but it is my belief that the majority of those who have rated it have only seen the film once.  Okay, so you might not be into the whole multiple viewing thing, but give this film a second chance and I promise that you will notice one of the most side-splittingly funny films you've ever seen!John Goodman gives a career best as the 'Nam' veteran with a chip on his shoulder and Jeff Bridges was born to play Jeff 'The Dude' Lebowski.  I have watched this film so many times that I have lost count and still, "new sh** comes to light" every time I see it.You've seen it once, now why don't you give it a second chance?  If you do watch this film for the second time and enjoy it more than the first, you can contact me to express your opinions.  Even contact me if you still believe that it is poor and I will eat my hat!

I've seen this movie about 9000 times, but one line remains a mystery to me. In the scene where Walter tells The Dude that The Jesus is a pederast, the following conversation takes place:Walter: So how much did they give you? Dude: 20 grand man, and of course I still get to keep the rug. Walter: Just for making the hand-off? Dude: Yeah, they gave the dude a beeper...so whenever these guys call... Walter: What if it's during a game? Dude: Oh, I told them that if it was during leagueplay... Donny: What's during leagueplay? Walter: Life does not stop and start at your convenience, you miserable piece of s***.My question is about this last line. Who is Walter talking to? It seems unlikely that he's talking to The Dude, because I don't think he would call The Dude a 'miserable piece of s***'. Well, he could, but only when emotions are rising. This seems not to be the case in this scene. On the other hand: if he's talking to Donny (who ís always interfering at his convenience) his timing is way off (his reaction would be way too fast)!Any ideas?

reviews.review_title: The Dude Abides, and Shatters the Comedy Genre Single-Handedly
reviews.content: I've watched my share of comedies, and in all this time I've only been able to single out four as definitive and making a mark on the movie industry and establishing themselves as classics: Ghostbusters (the first one, mind you), Caddyshack (also only the first), National Lampoon's Animal House, and (drum roll please), The Big Lebowski. Let's discuss that last one further, shall we? The Big Lebowski follows the story of Jeffry "The Dude" Lebowski, an L.A. bum who gets sucked into the underground crime scene, drugs, sex, rock and all. I can't really give away more info than that without spoiling something, so that's all I will say in regards to the plot. On the character side of the movie, the whole film is comprised of bums, thugs and wackjobs, all who are lovably bizarre. While the characters all seem to have one-track minds, you never seem to tire of them and are all amusing in their own way (for example, Walter constantly tells Donny to "shut the f**k up", Donny is always almost completely unaware of what's going on throughout the movie, The Dude always says some witty one-liner that lightens the mood the way any stoner could, etc.). The script is absolutely hysterical and top-notch, as can be expected of the Coen brothers, and the acting is completely believable, despite how far out the dialogue and events are. How could anybody forget The Dude's reaction when they drag him out of the limo while he's drinking a White Russian? Well, here it is: "Whoa whoa, h-hey dude, careful, I've got a beverage here!" Overall, I loved everything about the movie. It's an incredibly fresh, original movie that can't possibly be put in any specific genre it's so unique. Here's a warning though: the first time you watch it, you might not enjoy it as much as the next time, as it's one of those movies that gets better with age. This can perhaps attribute to the commercial and critical failure it exhibited upon release, but since has grown so huge, that they have made a convention for it named Lebowskifest. Once you get sucked into the wild world of The Dude, you will never want to leave.

reviews.review_title: Wow, dude, you have to see this movie!!
reviews.content: This film is a masterpiece of frivolity, invention and homage. Although Bridges is superb as the dude, the deadbeat 90s reincarnation of the film noir detectives of yesteryear, and the setpieces are truly memorable, the show is stolen by Goodman's ferocious Vietnam vet. He manages to play the frustration of paranoia and impotence within the constraints of compassion and, above all, loyalty. Hijacking the dude's every move, he muscles in on the chance to escape the boredom of his provincial life and glowers through the entire movie.Of course, these are not the only notable performances from the Coens' familiar cast. The film is helped by a host of SUPERB supporting performances (Buscemi's put-upon bowling pal, Turturro's latino pederast and the awkward PSH particularly spring to mind) - and the script is just amazing. This film is destined to become a classic.It is punctuated with moments of genius (from the best golfing gag ever through the North by Northwest pencil tracing homage, and the most painful "hit in the face with..." scene on film) and beautifully shot throughout (the bowling ballet opening sequence and Jesus' Hotel California are a joy to behold). And the narrator could not have been better chosen.The film does maybe lack the melancholic, disciplined humour of Fargo, but it is just as good a film in other respects.I recommend you buy, rent or steal a copy right now and enjoy yourself thoroughly!!!

I will say this...It is worth the rental to see Jesus Quintano dance a sultry dance while a Spanish version of "Hotel California" plays in the background. Just too hot to be a pedophile. HAHA. Just be careful. He will *beep* you in the *beep*. He won't *beep* you in the *beep* on Saturday. No, he will wait until Wednesday. You got a date!!!! HA HA HA Claims that a day of rest is for Busch league. But, he feels generous, so he will wait until Wednesday. Laughable. HA HA HA HA HA Two thumbs up Mr. John Turturro. Two thumbs way way up.

The dude has influenced my wardrobe, my way of life, and my haircut. I've bought the sweater, have the glasses, found a bowling ball at a second hand shop. Clear jelly sandals, deep cut white v neck t-shirt, shorts.. It's now part of my wardrobe too. Searching for identity? Look no further than Mr Lebowski, or 'the dude' to his friends.The calm approach the Dude has taken to life is the narrative of an overpriced self help book. 'How to beat the stress of modern living.'Brilliant acting, amazing music, great script, two of the most talented people in Hollywood at the helm. The Cohen brothers have created some amazing, thoughtful, funny pieces. This sits atop that pile.Great cult movie, deserving of its reputation. To be a part of the movie, to see it arrive at cult status in the early 2000s and to attend a Lebowski fest last year in Melbourne was a highlight of this century.

The Big Lebowski transcends the typical boundaries of slapstick humor, and replaces them with a deeper, more meaningful cinematic work.The acting in this movie is more than simply well done. John Goodman performs in one of the most hilarious comedy roles to date, and Jeff Bridges undergoes the transformation to "The Dude" easily. A brilliant movie with a great punchline, constant laughs, and stereotype-knocking gags make this a must see.
Rating: 9 of 10

reviews.review_title: A must have, must watch, piece of cinematic genius.
reviews.content: In every great directors career there is a film where all the stars align. The script is perfect, the acting is impeccable and the movie seems to just magically fall into place. The Coen brothers could have not put together a more well balanced and enjoyable film, this is there defining moment, this will be there masterpiece.Years later audiences still enjoy the story of "the Dude" (Jeff Bridges) and his laid back approach to life, not to mention his love of bowling with his eclectic mix of friends - Walter (John Goodman) and Donny (Steve Buscemi). This is a tale of intrigue and layered complexity that is only reserved for the finest of films with stellar performances by the whole cast, including a legendary performance by John Turturro as "The Jesus".As we wait for the next generation to discover this cinematic gem. This film will abide, as will The Dude.

reviews.review_title: Cult classic with great performances... only gets better with age
