reviews.content: Is it just me or has this movie progressively gotten better every year since it was released like 8 years ago?Just the setting of the film, the brilliant performances by John Goodman, Jeff Bridges, Phillip Seymour Hoffman, John Turturo, Julianne Moore, David Huddleston (millionaire lebowski)... besides it's so well written and is just a riot. How many memorable lines can you fit in one movie? Lebowski is great as an almost tragic/flawed hero figure. He's a hard luck lazy stoner, yet you still get a feeling of greatness from him. From some of the things he tells us about his past and from his respected presence in the film, he's just truly a classic, unforgettable movie character. I still think the best role in the film is played by Goodman, who is absolutely f**king brilliant as Walter. I mean, admit it- who didn't forgive him for 8 years of Roseane on the spot? I like the slight philosophical under-text of the film and all the archetypes it portrays between the Dude, Walter, the Millionaire Lebowski, Maude Lebowski, nihilism, pacifism - and using it all as a punchline is hysterical.Oh, and Turturo is immediately in the running for 'most memorable comedy cameo ever' with Jesus, the perverted foul-mouthed sh*t-talker. You said it man, a true cult classic in every sense.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films, period - Dude!
reviews.content: Come on! This is the best film ever. i', even raising this above LOTR, since this is contemporary. I grew up living like the Dude. The Dude reminds me of my Uncle...not in a bad way, but with deep respect to living one's own life.The Coen brothers have created a film to be topped, if it was possible. Barton Fink was great..Fargo, yeah it was exceptional story-telling. But, the Dude - that was well-crafted cinema.The only other film that I have seen of theirs that captured me as much was No Country for Old Men.Can't wait for the next surprise!

reviews.review_title: You are not privy to the new s***
reviews.content: This is my number two all time favorite movie. Why? This movie is an onion. Even now years after it's release, I watch it and the layers unfold. What I have discovered is that the movies that somehow, mysteriously move me in unknown ways upon the first viewing turn out to be religious metaphors. Blade Runner. Pretty obvious if you at least a faint whiff of imaginative ability. The Big Lebowski is more subtle. Watch the movie and count how many times "Jesus" is said. Was Jesus betrayed by the Jews? He was in TBL. It's all there. An "immaculate conception", a betrayal, a crucifixion, a rebirth. Who is the Jesus metaphor? It's the car. The car carries the characters throughout the movie and is sacrificed in the end by nihilists. The car carries the reward, the million dollars, that turns out not to be there because the money is not the reward. Bowling is the reward. Donny is reborn as The Dude and Walter return to the lanes. The idolater falls. Maude becomes the next Mary Magdelene. Walter is Paul. The Dude is John. Not even the Cohen brothers can escape the Judeo-Christian core of our society. Of course, escape is not necessary. If Jesus can't f*** you on Saturday, he'll f*** you next Wednesday. Hey, check out my album, Tacos and Bowling on itunes: http://phobos.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/ viewAlbum?playListId=39322321 We all abide.

reviews.review_title: The Big Lebowski is One Big Laughbowski
reviews.content: There are many things to love about movies; the smell of popcorn, the taste of butter, the John Goodman moments, and of course, the Big Lebowski. If you like to laugh at one deadbeat stoner who has a passion for oriental rugs, and forgets to comb his hair, you will love this movie. It is written by the Coen brothers, who have wrote about a thousand great movies. Unfortunately they are dead now, but this movie is still alive. MY favorite thing about this movie, the reason why it gets 9 stars, every single line is mildly funny. Of course, you cannot laugh out loud at every single line, but you will find yourself giggling inside every time John Goodman opens his mouth. God, so funny. Watch this movie sober or not...your choice! Either way, funny as hell. At one point the Dude is tripping on a illicit substance...oh my god, the cinematography is amazing!!! The viewer is experiencing a TRIP in someone else's perspective. Very novel and unique. I watch this movie whenever I can with friends. You should do the same :)

reviews.review_title: The Big Lebowski is the best mess you could watch.
reviews.content: The first time you watch The Big Lebowski you tend to find it messy and not very coherent, but that's exactly what the movie needs. The Big Lebowski isn't about the dude or his rug, it's not about bunny and her problems with known pornographers, it's not about Jeff Lebowski giving the dude a ringer, and it's definitely not about Donny. Shut the f*** up Donny. No, the movie is really about the characters. Its about watching these very imaginative characters and their mannerisms. Its about watching how they act and react with one another and seeing how their personalities get them in and out of tough situations. Ultimately the plot is so messy because the Coen brothers don't want you to focus on the details on why what is happening or what motivation brought these characters here. There is but one motivation in the movie that matters, the dude wants his rug back and he just wants to get it back without having to bother anyone. The situation these characters are put in is what makes the movie funny and the way that they react is how we learn from these characters. Plot is important in some movies, but when the characters are the ones who have the story to tell, why not stop worrying and just listen to them. The next time you watch this movie, forget about what's happening and just enjoy these hilariously inapt characters navigate their way through the mess that is The Big Lebowski.

reviews.review_title: The more times you watch this movie, the better it gets!
reviews.content: To anyone that did not like this movie or gave it a bad review, please do yourself a favor and watch it again. I thought it was pretty good the first time I saw it but I would say it is great after the third and fourth times. Probably the most re-watchable movie ever made. Clever writing and great acting = One of the best Coen Bros movies, ever!1)Fargo 2)The Big Lebowski 3)No Country For Old Men. "Jackie Treehorn treats objects like women, man."

reviews.review_title: A waste of time. Never in anybodys life that you would turn up.to a looser to save your problemes
reviews.content: What a waist of my time. How on earth, a succesfull man turn an big looser to save it's problem? I stoped watching after am hour.

Great movie. Coen Brothers and Roger Deakins how bad can it be .Take look at this , this movie has it's own religion called Dudeism.It derives from The Dude , the main character of the movie.The thing that made this movie irreplaceable is his responses to the incidents that happen to rather than the movies plot.Doubtlessly the most beloved character in this movie is 'The Dude' but we shouldn't forger Walter too.He is the guy that makes you laugh every single second as you watch. This movie also includes criticism about Vietnam war and other political cases that makes this masterpiece even better.If you really understand the characters and watch this movie with analyzing them without looking other components I have no doubt that you are gonna really enjoy this movie.And surely you're gonna envy the lifestyle of the dude. Moreover Jeff Bridges is definitely the best actor for playing The Dude. If you watched it and didn't like it . Yeah ,well, that's just, like, your opinion, man.

reviews.review_title: 1 of the top 100 funniest movies of all time!!!
reviews.content: Gut busting laughter from start to finish.. Omg Jeff Bridges Is TOTALLY AMAZING..A must see. EVEN THOUGH IT DID NoT DO WELL IN THEATERS, OT TURNED OUT TO BE A GLOBAL TREASURE IN THE JANRA OF COMEDY.I LOVE IT.
Don't have much to add! Please, don't waste your time!

reviews.review_title: Coen perfection - times like these call for a big Lebowski indeed.
reviews.content: Joel and Ethan Coen have a unique ability to populate their films with fantastic quirky characters, and unbelievable imaginative visuals, and they have never done it as good as in The Big Lebowski.The Coens again delve into the world of kidnapping, this time the story centers around the kidnapping and ransom demands of a famous millionaire. The acting, comedic timing, direction and sharp writing make this film the funniest film in a long,long time (how could you forget this film, AFI).

reviews.review_title: Funny as Hell and Twice as Surreal
reviews.content: This film is one of the most mind-blazingly funny (and I use that expression for no other reason than wanting to say "mind-blazingly) comedies I've ever had the pleasure of viewing. Perhaps it's my penchant for hyper-surrealist humor (Monty Python, Kids in the Hall, Upright Citizens Brigade, South Park, I could give two craps if you're insulted by the grouping, they're all warped and they're all hysterical), perhaps its that I finally found a movie that can satisfy the intellectual in me and still hold the attention of the slightly cerebrally-challenged around me whom I usually have to trick to see my kind of movie ("Dude, you better not have been lying about Woody Allen making a movie about Navy Seals"), but this film ranks up there with my all-time favorites. Incredibly quotable and utterly hysterical, this movie should be seen by anyone and everyone, and if they don't like it...well, that's just...like...their opinion, man.

reviews.review_title: Gets Better Each Time You See It
reviews.content: Like many other reviewers here, I'll confirm that "The Big Lebowski" achieves higher planes of brilliance with each viewing. There is not a single detail of this film that is not intentionally placed and you'll never catch them all the first time, yet alone the third time. Repeat viewings are like peeling away the layers of a magnificent onion.After at least ten viewings over a two year period, I finally saw the True Light: this is an off-kilter remake of "The Big Sleep."Rent the classic Bogart/Hawks/Chandler film "The Big Sleep" and then watch "The Big Lebowski" again. They both have a twisted plot, a rich man in Pasadena in a wheelchair, dangerous daughters, a rich and dangerous playboy/entrepreneur, nitwit thugs... instead of Philip Marlowe, we get The Dude, a bachelor, a bowler, and quite possibly the laziest man in Los Angeles County, which would put him in the running for laziest worldwide.I agree with all the other great reviews of this masterpiece.Laughable!!!  Ha Ha!!!

Nothing else comes to mind when I hear somewone mention "The Big Lebowski". It is simply the best movie I have ever seen! The more stupid and outrageous it gets, the more hilarious it becomes. This movie includes everything that an excellent movie calls for; awesome casting job (Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Sam Elliot, Steve Buscemi, etc), humor nothing can deliver, bowling, some lazy guy named Dude, to some "self-described" Nihilists. The Coen Brothers have once again made movies more enjoyable. I highly recommend this flick for anyone who needs a good laugh.

reviews.review_title: Well, man it's a great movie, ya know?
reviews.content: My thinking about this movie had become so uptight man, It's like well you know uhh better than uhmm Fargo, man. Great soundtrack, hilarious characters and situations from the demented mind shared by the Coen bros.

If you look beyond the outlandish plotline and the unique characters, you will see that this is unquestionably one of the best movies of the 1990's. The characters are real: they are symbols of the mixed-up, weather-beaten, all-but-forgotten world in which they live.  The press did not like this movie and therefore, it was not treated fairly.  If you open your mind, you will relish the experience of The Big Lebowski.

This movie is simply fantastic.  The Coen brothers have once again outdone themselves.  Amazing imagery coupled with a fantastic, though brief, performance by John Turturro paints a hilariously poignant picture of the bowling subculture.  The Coen Brothers have long been known for paying less attention to the plot than they pay to the visuals and the interaction of their characters, and this film is no exception.  The plot is somewhat confusing and contains innumerable twists, but what lies at the heart of this movie is solid: The relationship that is developed between John Goodman and Jeff Bridges is funny, and it reveals quite a bit about their characters.  Overall I thought this movie was outstanding.  Even though it didn't reveal any eternal truths about the human spirit, I had fun while watching it, and that's all the truth I need.

Those who have said that this is not a good movie didn't understand one bit of it, or tried to understand too much. This is an 'awesome' movie (,man) and it is unique in the way it brings bottom-of-the-belly laughing (or: the instinctive, natural type of laughter if you'd like) to a modern genre that's hard to associate with humor. One of the best I've ever seen besides Jim Jarmusch's Down by Law. Not that it's comparable, but...In short, it's a very funny, yet intellectual look at life through the eyes of the bozos that we all are. Go see it!

I think this is on of the funniest movies of all times, the characters (especially Goodman's) are so weird that you have to laugh on almost every line they say, go buy it! I gave it a straight ten. Also, Dude, people keep telling that the plot is not good or at least not as good as Fargo's. well that may be, but  therefore it was so funny and I think that the plot isn't so important here anyway. You'd miss most of it anyway cause you've got to laugh all the time. Also, try some White Russian during the movie it'll improve a lot if you don't like it.

One of the many reasons I've grown to love Coen Bros. films is that they increase my vocabulary.  Let's face it, how many of us know the definition of "micturate"?To paraphrase Nathan Arizona, watching Coen Bros. movies has become my "whole god-damned raison d-etre"!

reviews.review_title: Best Coen Brothers Flick to Date
reviews.content: I personally think this is truly one of the great masterpieces of comedic film.  Awesome.  It offers so much nuance comedy that it becomes the type of movie you can watch about thirty times and still find new things to laugh at.  If you have not seen this movie, please do so ASAP, it will be good for you.

The Big Lebowski is my favorite movie. No other has such subtly masterful interaction with such colorful characters. It is not a high suspense thriller or a drama, but a fun-time feel good comedy that doesn't try too hard to get there. But isn't that what the movie is about.It's just about sitting back and enjoying the ride. I have seen it +20 times and it still has a friendliness about it. The action heats up just so often, but it doesn't disturb.There is so much slacker-ing that it sort of rubs off and makes you feel at peace just to sit there and take it all in. And it's real funny too.

This is definitely one of the smoothest movies ever.  The Dude is such a great character, no cares in the world.  John Goodman is also great, I love all his Vietnam flashbacks and his slamming Donny is hysterical!  If you haven't seen it then this is definitely a great movie to see!

I loved this movie when I saw it in the theater -- and it never gets old. There are so many moments in this movie that you just think about and chuckle over for days afterwards...Jeff Bridges is truly awesome as a lazy anti-hero.  But I really think every eccentric character in this movie shines, they're all doing something very different here...This is my favorite movie of all time.  I laugh every time I see it.  I really do!

The Big Lebowski is a must! It makes me think that there's still some great american movies, with UNpolitically correct attitude. Weird behaviour, weird thoughts, weird lifes: The Dude and his pals show how american movies can fit the european sense of humour. It's all about bowling and p***ing on a rug. Only the Coen brothers can make movies like that, and they must be thanked for this true jewel!
I thought this movie was off the wall and I loved it.  I really got a good laugh and a kick out of this movie.  Jeff Bridges' acting was excellent...very cool and calm.

reviews.review_title: Funny film full of great one-liners
reviews.content: I'd seen no reviews or synopsis of this film when I picked it up in my video library. The fact that it was a Coen brothers film was enough to make me rent it. I was not disappointed. It's a warm, funny film full of great one-liners.Only the Coen's could take a rambling plot and laid back characters and tie it all up neatly together. For me, their finest.

>Superlatives ensue: I find the Big Lebowski to be exceedingly entertaining. The three main actors (Bridges, Buscemi and Goodman) did an extremely convincing job. In fact, it's hard for me to watch another movie with Jeff Bridges in it and not expect him to say, "new shit has come to light, man!"The convoluted plot comes ties together like a perfect episode of Seinfeld, and the scenes are shot beautifully, esp. the bowling and dream montages. The script is witty and hilarious without being juvenile and soooo many classic lines can be gleaned from it. This movie is a classic--you will laugh harder everytime you see it. The Sarsparilla man is right--it does make one feel safe knowing that "The Dude" is out there.

THERE'S A RELIGION for its time and place... It fits right in there, helps us abide through all the strikes and gutters, the ups and downs of the whole darned human comedy. It really ties your life together. And the religion for our time and place is Dudeism. Having an official religion movement based on a movie is in itself an achievement worthy of recognition. The so called laid back attitude has turned into a goal for many in the stressed everyday life of the urbanized society of today. Perhaps this is why some might consider the movie a religion. You can find out if this is so or not for yourself. Personally, I highly recommend seeing this.

The first time I saw this great artwork of the Coen brothers I was really surprised that it is able to top "Fargo" and "Raising Arizona". Goodman's "You're entering a world of pain"-scene is the best of all in my opinion. "Mark it zero!" and "Have you ever heard of Vietnam?" are my all-time-favourite phrases of this movie and of course the destruction of "Lenny's" car was really awful! I can't get tired of watching this movie again and again and again!I'm giving this movie 23 points out of 10!

I can just say that this particular peice of storytelling by the brothers cohen,really did uplift my spirits,and brought back to me just how life was for me,being a lebowski type character,if only i had the big fellas resolve....

I missed The Big Lebowski when it was at theaters, and after reading all the hoopla and praise foisted in its direction, had to rent it and finally see it.Big mistake.As with Pulp Fiction, I just don't see what the hype is about. The humor is sparse as far as I'm concerned, with John Goodman's character being the only redeeming part of the entire movie.Yeah, I paid attention. And I watched it twice. It didn't help.Some people have raved over the joke that the main character's rug "Really tied the room together". If that is what passes for great humor, well count me out.

This movie quickly became my favorite film after seeing it as "El Gran Lebowski" in Chile this past summer. This is an artistically beautiful movie, with great character development, hilarious dialogue, gorgeous cinematography, and music that serves to bring it all together. Also a great movie if you're in an altered state of consciousness, if you know what I mean. John Goodman and Jeff Bridges make a wonderful comedic pair. This is yet another gem from the Coen Brothers.

reviews.review_title: It's about characters, it's about acting, and Jeff Bridges is Outstanding!
reviews.content: I found Jeff Bridges' performance in this movie to be delightfully haunting. The supporting cast is strong, the plot is unpredictable, and the laughs are frequent.....the 'Dude' is straight out of the late 60's.....with Bridges absolutely *nailing* the character. Great movie, great portrayal.

The Big Lebowski - a virtual masterpiece.  Stunning visuals, from excellent dolly shots to amazingly trippy aerial sequences.  Add to it the wacky perspective which made Fargo so great, and you can see why Lebowski is another hit.  Great performances from Bridges, Goodman, Buscemi, and Turturro.  Turturro's character alone is enough to get the repeat viewer laughing. . .and everything else will take care of the first timer.  Read Drewzus' review. . .this is hilarious.  Side-splitting.  A comic masterpiece which cannot be overlooked.  Yeah.  "The Dude, duder, El Dudorino if you're not into the whole brevity thing."

Just as some people hate Jim Carrey's movies (I do), I can perfectly imagine that some will not find this film funny. If you have a slightly 'stupid' sense of humour (i.e. if you appreciate the ridicule, like, for example, what the Monty Python do), you'll just love this film. Personally, I found it so funny that I was crying.

reviews.review_title: Without a doubt, one of the greatest movies ever made!
reviews.content: Even while pressing myself during a period of neurotic fits, I was not able to come up with a more perfect film.  Funny to no end, chalk full of ingenuity, poignant as a red clam, this film has it all.  A movie so good, that watching it is like eating a little slice of heaven.

This movie is a masterpiece, the Coen brothers are at their best here. Movie purists might argue that the film lacks a coherent plot but the fact that the film succeeds without one is precisely what makes it so entertaining. Jeff Bridges as the 'Dude' reveals a comedic and indeed an acting talent I never knew he had, not to be overlooked a standout performances by John Goodman, John Torturro and Julianne Moore to name a few. The dialogue of the film is fast paced and witty with some acid induced dream sequences. As stated earlier, the plot is incomprehensible but how many Coen brother movies are'nt. The soundtrack reminds you that music can add to the plot and movement of events and you are unlikely to ever come across a more unfortunate protagonist than 'the dude'. I recommend this film to anyone, I emphatically stick two thumbs up.

I use this film as a vitamin pill! It is so well made, with so many small crazy or should I say normal things that goes wrong. Some of it reminds me of myself when I am having one of those days where everything goes wrong.Did I laugh when the Dude hammered the chair to the floor against the door so nobody could get in..... Jeff Bridges plays so well, he should have had an Oscar for this role. I keep watching this film again and again, and new things to laugh at appears every time.This is just my sense of humor! It is brilliant and cleverly made. Fargo was great too. I wonder if there are any other films made by these same people, in such case I must watch them.

The big Lebowski is perhaps one of the funniest, most intriguing and most enjoyable movies I have ever seen.  It combines the genres of mystery, comedy, satire and drama by using a long, drawn out plot, full of twists and turns that keep the viewer interested.  Aside from its obvious humor("Nice Marmot"), the movie is basically a satire, arranged around themes, not necessarily chronologically, although the movie is fluid (if you could follow that).  The movie at first is very confusing, but after one views it once or twice, the nuances of it become apparent; for example, pay attention to what "The Dude" says first about the kidnapping.  Everything that seems to be completely out of order comes together at the end.  As a satire, it makes fun of the traditional romantic hero, one who goes against the common social mores of the time.  The Dude is the typical American slacker, with no real dreams or ambitions except for winning the county bowling competition. This is a kind of slap in the face of those who would accuse the youth of America, and say that they will fail, just as the Big Lebowski does.Bowling, to the Dude comes to represent a new kind of religion, a purity in an otherwise futile life.  In no way does bowling give the Dude or Walter, or even Donny, a set of rules to follow, rather it does give them a sense of inner peace.  Bowling is almost a zen activity to the Dude; everything melts away, all his cares and sorrows, reduced to how he'll roll that night.The movie isn't an endorsement for drugs, sex, rock and roll, or even bowling, but it is an advertisement to stop and think about what we are all doing in our hum-drum lives.

reviews.review_title: The best of the Coens offerings to date
reviews.content: As a huge fan of the Coens (arguably the best film makers in the entire industry) I was waiting for this film with all of the excitement of a child on christmas day, present in hand just waiting to start ripping.  Fargo was the finest black comedy/film noir update I had seen for a long time so I figured the Big Lebowski would be something maybe slightly more low key, an above average film but perhaps nothing overly special.  I was wrong.  This film is, in my opinion, the best Coen brother movie if not the greatest black comedy ever committed to celluloid. The characters are established immediately, each needing only one line of dialogue to make you feel like you really know them which really invests the audience in the films plot.  The dialogue itslef is the best of its kind, witty and stylised banter that could only be put together by Joel and Ethan Coen. In short this is an amazingly well crafted film that deserves to be recognised in the highest echelons (hmmm is my spelling correct?) of movie making.  As close to perfection as you are gonna get from a black comedy (even better than Dead Mans Curve, which is certainly saying something)Watch this film!!!

reviews.review_title: Satirical and comedic genius at work
reviews.content: Okay, so the language is extremely rough, probably the highest number of f words to ever be uttered in a movie. But in a decade chock-full of trashy, pathetic attempts at comedy, The Big Lebowski is a refuge that is the most original comedy in years. Jeffery "The Dude" Lebowski, with his laid back attitude, gets mixed up in a screwy plot of misunderstanding and just plain idiocy. His buddy Walter, the scene-stealer, the Vietnam vet. Walter's personality and foul-mouthed rants create a crude but hilarious comedic effect. The dialogue is witty throughout the movie, full of sarcasm and political satire, and must be listened to carefully to be sure none of the punchlines are missed, as this movie could be a radio program and barely lose any of the humour. I warn you that this movie bores anyone bearing a sense of humour that is unwilling to endure such an absurd comedy.

Each scene stands alone as a gem of absurdity and harmony.  It's great. The Dude's clothes? - perfectly ugly.  Beautiful.  Walter's expression during Jesus' warning... For me by far the best line first time through was "I don't F****** roll on Shabbos".  Being shomer Shabbos myself, if I had been drinking milk at the time, I feel sorry for the people sitting in front of me.  I do wonder how that line and the following explanation struck those who were not familiar with the Jewish Sabbath. Now, my favorite line is, "well, that's just like, ah, your opinion, man." I love it. And let's not forget "we still want the money, Lebowski". I think this movie must be the greatest provider of great quotes ever.I also enjoy the flashbacks now brought to me every time I hear Just Dropped In or Lookin' Out My Back Door. Oh, no, he has health problems. That's my robe. That's your name, Dude. The landlord's dance. The p*d off cabbie Eagles fan. Fawn Knudson. Opening scene of the joy of bowling. The Dude's ID. Again, his clothes. A string of gems.

you must watch this film at least 3 times to fully appreciate its brilliance.  jeff was born to play this part.  he does dude so well that whenever you see him in any other role, you will think bl.  the acting in this film is truly the finest i have ever witnessed.  many people disagree because it is a comedy.  they think that oscar caliber acting should be reserved for dramas.  rent this one and watch it alone, concentrate, let the dude embrace you,  let yourself embrace the dude, be one with the dude and you shall see the light.  grasp the greatest lesson. abide.

reviews.review_title: I got a beverage here man!
reviews.content: This movie is like a big, great Three's Company episode in a way.  Constant misunderstandings.  Note that all the characters misread the dude's motivations for doing whatever it is he's doing.  Jeffrey Lebowski believes he's trying to rip him off.  Jackie Treehorn thinks he's trying to muscle in.  The detective thinks he's a brilliant sleuth (playing both ends against the middle etc.)  And so on and so on.  Everyone finds it impossible to believe that he's JUST THE DUDE, takin' 'er easy for the rest of us.  Also, why wasn't Jeff Bridges nominated for an Oscar for this?  This has to be his best performance ever, and it stands out among a host of them here.

Every once and a while a true life style movie comes along and you can relate to one or more of the characters.  Well like Homer Simpson all of us has a little "dude" in him.  Thats a good thing we need more Dudes then attitudes in our times.  Although all might not agree with him one gets the feeling of what the films message is and thats what "ties it altogether, did it not! "Grade A"

The only movie I watched three times in cinema. Thoroughly funny, John Goodman alias Walter Sobchak is outstanding. The introduction of "Jesus" is one of the highlights in cinema history (although the character itself is as unimportant as the whole bowling matter...the movie even doesn't tell you who won the semis...).

I have never seen a movie that I can watch over and over again and still laugh out loud at every classic moment.  The Big Lebowski does it for me all the way.  Many people told me it was stupid and not funny.  Of course those were the same people who regard American Pie as the funniest movie ever. Not that slapstick comedy doesn't make me chuckle, but I cannot hold a conversation with somebody who thinks Don't Be a Menace to South Central... is a classic.  This movie gets my vote for good wholesome family fun.

The Big Lebowski is a wonderful comedy with a twisting somewhat complex plot not usually found in this genre. John Goodman delivers an especially humorous performance as an Vietnam vet who never really has anything under control and Jeff Bridges plays the slacker "Dude" who gets thrown into an amazing twist of events thanks to merely sharing the same name as a millionaire. Highly recommended if you've never seen it.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies of all time!!!
reviews.content: Bowling, Beer, and Drugs; what more could you possibly ask for from a movie? How about a show dog(with *&%$#@# papers).  Bowling, as it is meant to be played, is the key element in this movie.  Donny is without a doubt one of the funniest characters in any movie ever made.I love Walter's take no &*^% attitude.  He always has a plan(I also heard that he was in NAM).  He refuses to give in to any opponent, calling them all *&%$#@# amateurs.The Dude.................Need I say more!

This movie I saw for the first time in winter of 1999. I didn't really pay much attention to it because I was tired and I had seen two other rentals prior to this one. I thought to myself, nothing special. Then about a month to a month and a half ago I saw it at the flea market here for sale at $5. There wasn't much else to do or buy so I got it. I watched it again and it blew me away. It is such a well constructed plot with many twists and turns and incredibly well developed and sympathetic characters. I found a new respect for John Goodman's acting abilities. I had always thought that Jeff Bridges was ok but his performance here made his stock go up in my personal opinion. Then you have other people who made the movie a delight like John Turturro, Steve Buscemi, and Julianne Moore. The Coen Brothers have an amazing talent for screenplay writing and I can't wait for their next project. It has even inspired me more to write a little something myself.

The Coen brothers `Big Lebowski' is without a doubt the best comedy movie of all time. Jeff Bridges plays the character of the lazy pot-smoking `dude' so well you actually believe the hilarious remarks he makes are genuine. His friend Walter (John Goodman) is the stereotypical Vietnam vet that manages to relate everything to Vietnam no matter how remote the situation is. This movie is great aphrodisiac after a long stressful day at school or work. Unlike most comedy movies `The Big Lebowski' gets better every time you watch it. I recommend that a person watch it at least twice to get the full effect of the Coen brothers' genius, better yet buy the video or DVD, this movie just keeps getting funnier every time!

reviews.review_title: Like all things Coen, incredibly underrated.
reviews.content: You know you love them.  Coen movies have that quirky something or other that at times will make you laugh out loud or squirm in your seat, sometimes at the same time.  The only movie I think that doesn't fit this mold was Blood Simple (less funny than the rest).  But it was still VERY good.  Some movies are more funny.  Some are more violent.  But there is always a mixture of the two.  It's refreshing to see movies these days that don't resort to spooge jokes and CGI F/X cheating and hip-hop soundtrax. I'm starting to ramble.  Anyway, I love this movie.  Love, love, love it. When I got a DVD player last fall this was the first movie I bought, and I have watched it on average of once a week since then.  I'm no expert by any stretch of the imagination, but I know a well made movie when I see one. And I know when a writer/director cares for the characters, and it really comes through in this movie.  And it's funnier than anything that's been made in years.  Even After all the times I see it, I still laugh out loud at certain parts.  My wife and I quote it constantly to each other.  My Favorite parts (possible spoilers ahead):1. The scattering of the ashes (It's wrong but it feels oh so right), 2. The Dude in the Eagles Cab (I, too, fervently hate the Eagles) and, 3. The "marmot" in the tub So I recommend to anyone who wants a good laugh and a weird plot with some truly loveable characters, see this movie.  10/10

Every once in a while there comes a movie that leaves you with the feeling that you have witnessed genius. 'The Big Lebowski' is definitely one of those movies. You become entranced from the start by Sam Elliot's opening monologue and it never lets up. On first viewing, the movie can seem slow, confusing, and even boring, but do not let that stop you from seeing it again. 'The Big Lebowski'is an acquired taste. It is very good at first, and after a few more viewings it becomes undeniably excellent. Brilliantly crafted in the style of an old Hollywood mystery, 'The Big Lebowski' is one of the funniest and most original movies of all time. Its craftsmanship is perfect and the actors, notably Jeff Bridges, Phillip Seymore Hoffman, John Torturro, Steve Buscemi, Julianne Moore, and John Goodman, all put up some of the best performances of their careers. The script, by the Coen Brothers, is truly ingenious and its creativity is awe inspiring. There are hilarious subtleties that one only notices after seeing it again and again. I have seen the movie 17 times and it honestly gets funnier each time. 'The Big Lebowski' is truly the greatest movie ever made.

This is one of the funniest movies I have seen. There are more sub-plots in this movie than first meets the eye.  A big bonus for me is that my two teenage boys(ages 17,19)share the same opinion.  Common ground not always found.  Jeff Bridges turns in another great acting job.  The cast is almost to good to be true. The interaction between the "the dude" Donnie and Walter is very special.

reviews.review_title: Whats happened to the Coen brothers?
reviews.content: Just watched the Ladykillers and am most disappointed. Iv'e one question. Whats happened? Fargo, great. Big Lebowski, even better. Since then the Coen brothers have not produced anything that comes close. I don't know why this is but I really wish they could make a movie which is half as good as Lebowski. Stop using A list actors such as Hanks and Clooney and go back to your roots. Jeff Bridges performance as 'the dude' is a joy to behold. Can't imagine Hanks in that role or Clooney as someone who does'nt roll on Saturdays. I can only think that as their movies gained popularity in the 90's they thought they would up the ante and work with big movie stars and have bigger budgets. It has'nt worked! Please ditch all the movie stars and return to the great character driven, quirky movies of which you made your names. Here's hoping...

reviews.review_title: the best coen-brothers movie so far
reviews.content: first, this movie is must-see-must-have. all the little details, the colorful characters and great music makes it one of those movies you can watch time and time again. the acting is very good all-round, the dialog is just so funny, but most of all, the pacing is just SO right... everything seems to follow naturally, so you cannot help but being drawn in. my favorite coen-brothers movie so far, and a classic movie.

reviews.review_title: All the Dude ever wanted was his rug back...
reviews.content: Artistic, intriguing, and damn hilarious.  I love this movie through and through.  I always catch something new every time I watch it.  If you haven't seen this movie, get out there and rent it.  You don't know what you're missing.

reviews.review_title: Hilarity and action packed fun for all
reviews.content: This film could not be better! This has to be even better than Raising Arizona (Another terrificly witty piece of their's)! I Love the whole cast, sound track, silliness and seriousness! The whole thing was marvelous!! There couldn't have been a better choice of th actor for the "Dude" Jeff Bridges had it down from the very beginning milk drinking scene to the instigation of the whole "mystery"! A few of my favorite scenes being the whole slam dunk and mitterating scene. The degradation of the car. The "Nialist" in the parking lot. The ferret in the bath. Him listening to "The Best Bowling Moments" on a Walkman. The walk along the water with Donny in hand. Just to name a few. And who could forget the little hottie, the Mrs. Lebowski!

This is, by far, my favorite comedy of all time.  The acting is so real and the situation is so insane that it probably has happened somewhere out there.  Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, and John Turturro all give excellent performances and give the movie such depth that you can't help but grow to know and love there characters.  The music is terrific, especially "Just Dropped In" by Kenny Rogers and the New Edition, which is now one of my favorite songs.  This is one of those movie's that, if you carried the script in your pocket, could provide you with a thought provoking and extremely hilarious quote for any occasion.  Truly a masterpiece.

The Cohn bros produce the best cutting edge comedy of the 90's in this wacky and original flic. The writing is outstanding, as is the acting.  If only other filmmakers had their talents. On eof the few movies I would buy to have on hand.

This movie has spurned a cult following in the last two years. Simply quoting lines from this movie to others familiar with it sparks immediate commaradarie.  "Oh, Nice Marmut."  You can't help but chuckle at that. This is one of the best modern day film noirs I have ever seen.  At first glance it's a great comedy, watch it again and you notice it's also a noir, brilliant!   If you like the Cohen brothers watch:  "Miller's Crossing." Other movies that may interest you: "Chinatown" "The Big Sleep"(the cohen's actually based parts of Lebowski on this film, look for the guy in a wheelchair) also "Easy Rider"

This movie is definitely not for everyone; some people hate it and some cannot find it's humor. I find it absolutely hilarious! The casting is perfect and the dialog is fun. I like the way the characters mesh and clash and completely lose their tempers - John Goodman I'm talking to you - well done! It is funny and offensive to some, but I like that kind of movie.Jullianne Moore is so great in role of Maude Lebowski!Steve Buscemi and Philip Seymor-Hoffman also give great performances. Then of course there is "the dude" (Jef Bridges)the most laid back of them all. Be sure to check out his fashion choices (pay special attention to his shoes!) Someone mistakes him for a millionaire and instead of letting the incident go, an insane, dangerous and funny adventure results. How did he get into this mess? Bowling is known to solve all problems. As do White Russians. But watch out for those nihilists.

This is probably the funniest film I have ever seen. I can watch it again and again and never get bored. John Goodman in the role of his life. With Big Lebowski the Coen-brothers show that they are probably the best filmmakers in the world, along with Woody Allen.

reviews.review_title: HE IS THE DUDE OF THE CENTURY!!
reviews.content: i watched this film on T.V, before i watched it i thought it would be great anyway, but after watching i thought it was great. The coen brothers have exceeded themselves once again. The styl, wit and charisam of this film is great. The dream sequences are the most original scenes i have seen....American Beauty eat your heart out! The twisted humour of this film is nothing like i have seen before. everyone should watch this film its great.I can't wait for thier next film 'The man who was'nt there'.
The depictions of a easy going stoner is very funny to watch.(especially if your high)

reviews.review_title: Simply one of the best movie's you will ever see!
reviews.content: This movie crosses so many boundaries and limitations that 99.9% of all other comedies limit themselves to. Everything from a carpet p***ing thug to a pervert named "Jesus" that can bowl like no one's business is in this movie. Every scene makes my sides split. The plot rates up there with Akira and The Matrix, simply genius! So many twists and turns with an ending you have to see more than once to believe. Great music all throughout as well. Simply this movie has everything you could ask from a movie including many 1st rate A List actors that do a wonderful job. However do NOT see this movie if you are faint of heart or ears. LOTS of cursing as well as a few violent scenes and a couple nudity scenes as well as a hefty dose of inuendo and sexual jokes. But if you are like most people this will not even phase you and you will love every last line in the movie. I can't think of ANYTHING I would change in the movie.  Props to EVERYONE involved in making this movie, it is 1st rate.

reviews.review_title: in my top ten of all time greats
reviews.content: The Big L is one of the greatest films ever. It captures an ethos/way of life with amazing accuracy & attention to detail. Its comedy is both subtle & clever. words fail me, but it has to be said that those of you who think Fargo is the greater of the two have "lost the plot". I could easily watch this film over and over & still find new hidden gems hidden within (you can't say that about many). I think people have a problem with it cause it has no real beginning or end its  a section in the life of "the Dude" one can really say "it just is". A masterpiece the thesaurus doesn't contain enough words !

It couldn't be funnier , it couldn't be more classic.It should have won Oscars for best Actor(The Dude Jeff Bridges) and supporting Actor(Walter John Goodman),As well as movie of the year. Bunny, Maude, The Jesus , Donnie, Jackie Treehorn, Even Larry (is this your homework Larry?Your killin your father Larry, Have you ever heard of Vietnam Larry?) Classic writing , amazing actors, this will be a movie I'll watch at least a million more times, The only possible problem is THERE SHOULD BE A PART 2. Maudes pregnate , That could be used in so many ways,Lets hope wiser minds can make it so. If it were done I'ed be among the first to line up to see it.

Nothing else than pure genius. I hope you won't stop judging a movie from how many times they use the word f**k, would be really sad if you did so cause you would miss one of the best movies of all times.The Dude, who for some might be a total loser, stands up to the condition of hero, a great amazing slacking hilarious hero. A mention of his own for John Turturro who, despite having a really small part in the movie, comes out with an outstanding interpretation of "Jesus" which would be worth the price of the DVD on its own.What can I say, I love the Coen Brothers and this is without any doubt their best movie so far.If you still haven't seen it give it a shot, you won't regret it!

reviews.review_title: Perhaps the funniest movie of all time!
reviews.content: Perhaps the funniest movie of all time.  The Coens had always been masters of realistic sounding dialogue, in "Fargo" for example, but this movie puts it over the top.  Having lived in California for many years, it always reminds me of how people talked there; swearing, using "dude", "man", and "f**k", in every sentence, and not really finishing a sentence.  Overall a great movie.

reviews.review_title: A celebration of the unique nature of the lazy
reviews.content: To say the Big Lebowski is merely a comedy is to disregard what has to be one of the best scripted films to appear during the last 20 years.  Only the Coen Brothers possessed the bravery, foresight and genius to bring this celebration of the slackers and lowlifes to the screen.The strength of the Big Lebowski does not lie in its cinematography or its occasional special effects (which are excellent), but rather in its refusal to conduct itself like any other main stream film.  Repeatedly the film falls back upon the interaction between the characters.  Who can forget the various bowling alley dicussions between the Dude, Walter and Donny?  The way that through one conversation we are able to see deep into the far-out psyche of each character as they strive to plod along in their mudane and under-funder existence.The Coens attention to detail is another prominent feature of the film. Its the little things that count.  Such as the bullishly Jewish Walter's firm which is known as Sobchak Security, or SS for short.  Or maybe the Donnys inability to get a word in edgeways.  I have seen the film many, many times now, and each time I have seen something new, which can only serve as a testament to the Coens abilities as film makers.The plot of the Big lebowski is made so ridiculous that it could only be made 'real' by having a group of completely ridiculous characters.  The Coens refuse to leave even the most incidental character without some kind of strange background or character quirk.  Just see Brandt or the aggressive police sergent for examples.The Big Lebowski serves as a celebration of the lazy and unambitious.  In the Dude we find solace.  He makes you think: Why do i have to bother dealing with things?  Why stress over things that do not matter?As i believe a reviewer in Empire put it:  In an ideal world all films would be made by the Coen Brothers.

This is the Cohen's at their best - and the actors at their best! You put Miller's Crossing, Fargo, and Raising Arizona in a blender and you get the best 'Caucasian' ever made! How many quotes have come from this film? I've never gotten tired of this one. The guy that does the marmot scream used to live down the street from me. His voice is always found in their films. The last time that I talked to him, he was leaving Lexington for the West. He had just finished directing a Doc on 'Grunge Ukulele' musicians in the Pacific Northwest. I think that his most disturbing sound effect was the odd scream of the paid off boxer in Miller's Crossing. That one always makes ya wonder what grandpa's really going to do with the fire stoker when he picks it up on Christmas.

I never heard much of this movie until a few days ago. I mined the web for some information on it, and it seems like most reviews put it into the 2 to 3 star category. After seeing it, I couldn't disagree more. Not only is this movie hilarious, but it makes a quiet statement about living up to one's own expectations, and about life in general. Not everyone will "get it", as they say, but that's OK! This one has enough laughs to please anyone.

There were parts of this movie that made me laugh so hard, I had to stop watching it to catch my breath.  The actors are so perfect, so precise in their portrayal of their characters, I really feel like I am in So. Cal. in 1991.

reviews.review_title: Great movie I recommend it to everyone
reviews.content: The first time I saw this film i was young so i didnt really have any interest in it. But when i saw it a couple years later i went straight to the mall and bought it. I cant stop watching this movie. I laugh at every seen even though I've seen it  million times. The Coen bro's made another great movie to bad they dont give Best Picture for comedy's anymore. I think everyone should take a look at this film more than once and have a good laugh. Till next time "The Dude Abides."

My Dad absolutely loves this film; it speaks to him on a spiritual level or something. I personally don't understand the humour, and, when I do, find it too subtle to be funny. However The Big Lebowski doesn't fit into any other category of movie, so -- what is it?For me it was a disappointment, it having been so hyped up by my Dad. For others it was an absolute triumph, if you're into that kind of film. It takes a very specific person to enjoy a movie like that, but, if you do, it will certainly be one of your favourites. I guess it's much like Marmite, a kind of love-it hate-it situation. Personally I saw the funny side of it, and the reasons for it being such a cult classic, but it just didn't fit my style.Watch Fargo instead. If you've seen it, watch it again, and then think "could the Coen brothers outdo themselves?" If the answer is no, don't spoil your own opinion of them by seeing this film. If you think they could do something more out-there or interesting, sure give The Big Lebowski a go.

reviews.review_title: Fortunately I've been adhering to a pretty strict, uh, drug regimen to keep my mind, you know, limber.
reviews.content: That classic, one of many, line pretty much sums up the Dude.I cannot rave about this film enough.  Literally every scene is funny, if not downright hilarious.  What I want to know is how the Coen brothers come up with this stuff.  Their comedic writing is pure genius.The casting is outstanding, the acting great, and the direction is right on. Plus it has a awesome soundtrack.If you haven't seen this movie, RUN, don't walk, and buy it.  You will not be sorry.  I don't know why you're still reading this, I said go and buy it!10 out of 10

Great movie, great absence of enormous plot lines. Beautiful characters (with depth). Hilarious at some points, dramatic through situational humor.A great trip to the bowling alley of life. Jef Bridges is in great shape as the Dude, but John Turturro steals the show as the gay bowler. Steve Buscemi plays the same character over and over but he does it so well that all is forgiven.After seeing this movie, your carpet will be cherished, ashes of the departed treated with respect and a night out bowling will be more adventurous...

The first time I saw The Big Lebowski, I left the theater kind of scratching my head. What was it I had just watched? Sure, it had it's moments of true laugh-out-loud comedy, but was this movie just a comedy? Four years later, I can answer that question! It's a comedy! Each successive time I watched the film, I laughed harder. I laughed longer. These days, I like it better than Cats, I want to see it again and again. Seriously, after about two dozen viewings, this movie (in my opinion, the Coen Brothers' best) is a true masterpiece. It defines a time in American History. It defines a man, a man called "the dude." And he was a lazy man. And from opening credits to closing, these days I virtually laugh nonstop. He is the man, the man for his time and place...or however it goes.
It's not just another movie... It's a guide of how to live life. Seem a little over the top? Watch it, base your life on it, and enjoy life. Enough Said.

Well, Big Lebowski is the only movie I can watch 3 times in a row and enjoy every little scene of it. It has everything an excellent comedy should have - good plot, excellent actors performances, great camera work, music, brilliant dialogues and, most importantly, it is funny and entertaining no matter if watched for second or 1002 time.Be prepared that it will not make you roll on the floor laughing and it not as filled with gags as, say, Naked Gun series. Probably you won't even like it for the first time, or just find it weird. Trust me - just go watch it again. Tiny details are crucial in this movie and on the second view you start to notice and appreciate them.

reviews.review_title: A definite classic with superb actors
reviews.content: I must admit, that Big L is one of the best films I've ever seen! And believe me, I've seen a few. This is an ultimately cool and strange flick, filled with cool and strange characters.Jeff Bridges in one of the best and most interesting roles in his career as "The Dude". John Goodman gives an unforgettable performance as The Dude's (gun-)crazy friend Walter Sobchak. Superb acting together with great casting make this title a sure classic. Great soundtrack alone makes Big L worth watching (and listening). Well-written, well-directed and well-produced. If you like other films by Coen-brothers, be sure not to miss this!

reviews.review_title: My Favorite comedy of all time
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski is quite simply my favorite comedy of all time. It won't be for everyone and I can understand why some may find it a fairly odd film. Lets be honest... It is slightly odd but absolutely hilarious. John Goodman is fantastic as always and in my own opinion Jeff Bridges puts in his finest display ever as the laid back Lebowski. Steve Buscemi is... Well, Steve Buscemi but is perfect for his role.I don't feel all Coen Brother fans will love this as much as I do as I feel in many ways it is quite different from much of their other work. If I had to liken it to any of their previous work I would have to say the film 'The Naked Man.' Although as a Coen Brother fan myself It happens to be my personal favorite.Fans Of films such as 'Spinal Tap' and 'Withnail & I' will surely love this film. Just think, Students all over the world will be watching this film right now remembering various quotes to use from the film tomorrow. This may sound ghastly but hey... This film proves students do have taste after all:-D

reviews.review_title: There is no film around that better explores white Russians and bowling.
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski is frankly a terrific entertaining film.  When discussing the Coens and their output usually people jump all over Fargo or O, Brother Where Art Thou?.  I cannot fault them for this, as these are great movies. But I have always been drawn to those films that follow the bigger hits. The Big Lebowski wedged between the aforementioned Coen Brothers movies fits quite nicely.  The plot doesn't really matter.  It assuredly does twist and turn and is incomprehensible at times.  As this film is a take on the film detective genre, most notably The Big Sleep which doesn't make sense either, this is extremely acceptable.  Take the Bogart character that has all the answers out of the plot and place a burned out broke bowler that loves white Russians in his stead, throw in John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, Juliane Moore, Philip Seymour Hoffmann, and a funny, well-executed story and you have The Big Lebowski.  All-in-all, I would say about 3 stars out of four.

The funniest movie of all time one of the BEST movies of all time. I have never laughed so hard in my entire life. The Coen brothers truly are geniuses. Jeff Bridges gives an incredible performance (K-Pax eqsue) and the combo of John Goodman, Steve Buscemi and John Tuturro makes it awesome. And as an added bonus we get a sexy looking Tara Reid and an even sexier (if it is possible) Philip Seymour Hoffman.

Either you're life is going to be changed by it, or you're missing the whole point. A truly amazing observation on life, espacially on how to take it easy. Life is very simple and beautiful when you think and act like the Dude, even if they seem to get pretty much complex. Just sit back and enjoy the ride. Long live the dude!

This movie is superb. Easily one of the best. It's big, funny, sprawling. It never gets old. The comedy is superb. The characters are awesome. And it's a really good, entertaining take on Los Angeles. Superb.It's the Coen's at their best. You could argue they make two types of movies - the dark thriller and the absurd comedy. This (with a close second being Raising Arizona) is by far their most interesting work.I could spend the rest of this just quoting lines, but I'm not going to. If for some reason you haven't seen this movie, stop whatever you are doing and go rent it.

One day in school worldwide, when list of the movies that pupils have to see will be written your should definitely expect the Big Lebovski on ti. The manner and style of acting, the complexity of the story and rhythm of the film offer you unforgettable pleasure. It is a film that you will be back to regularly. If it happen to you not love it at first view, give him a few more chances. Think and consider each character separate and feel why this movie is admired around the world and have acquired the status of a cult film. Must see movie. The movie. TheBigLebovsky. So, without further writing a film that certainly should not be bypassed. I would be very happy if I haven't seen this movie to watch it once more and open my self a pleasure of watching it for first time. If you have seen it yet you are a lucky person. Enjoy.

This movie was good but by no means a master piece. The plot tried a bit to hard to be cleaver and the humor wasn't the best. The acting was good by all involved with the exception of Julian Moore who's acting was sub par. Worth a watch but don't go in expecting too much. I saw this in 2017 so maybe at the time the movie was better and doesn't hold up to more modern takes on similar story.

reviews.review_title: The best film the Cohen Brothers ever made
reviews.content: Frankly, this is the best film the Cohen Brothers ever made, it shows their strength at doing comedy, which frankly is what they do best.It's not a comedy of gags, nor one in which every line is tailored to achieve an effect. It's an intelligent script, fine tuned to make you laugh while you try to catch the underlying message.Every character fills the movie with flavor, while Jeff Bridges as The Dude and John Goodman as Walter Sobchak lead the cast, some lesser characters such as Philip Seymour Hoffman's Brandt and John Turturro's Jesus Quintana help to change the pace in the movie.This is one of this movies you watch and like, and after some time you see again and find a lot of small little details you missed the first time.It's definitely on my top 10 movies of all time, a must see.

reviews.review_title: The only review you need to read on The Big Lebowski
reviews.content: It's a really funny, solid movie. I totally think you should watch it if you haven't seen it... and if you have, then I'll see you at Lebowskifest in Seattle, 2010.Goodman's crowning achievement in acting. Bridges delivering lines with the white Russian in his mouth. Poor Donnie. Everything about this one screams "New Classic", which can be said of many of the Brothers' other films.But this has all been repeated Ad-nauseum; I am simply trying to stretch this to 10 lines so I can submit it.So stop reading this! Go watch it if you haven't seen it, you won't be sorry.

you get so much inspiration out of this movie, I saw the comments of this movie and there were the quotes. I read them and have to laugh again and again what a great movie is this. Absolutely a great end of the moive, with the best laugh of the night.

reviews.review_title: feel good movie, laughter with friends the best medicine!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: gotta love every minute of this movie. extremely well written and by far the best of all Coen films and they have made some good ones. love watching this film with friends after a night at the bars; always brings a smile to our faces. for all of us that take life too seriously, watch this and feel comfort.abiding in Chicago

reviews.review_title: Can there be a best film ever?
reviews.content: Yes, it can. Watch the film at least 3 times! I watched it over 25 times. Ever time I watch it, I discover something new. Last time I watched it I discovered that Walter is a owner of a security shop: "Sobchack securites". I rang my best friend and asked him if he knew what Walter does for a living. He flipped! I tortured him by not telling him :))) He watched the film more than 50 times, and didn't knew the answer (americans: don't forget we also have subtitling here, some we can't notice everything!). Anyway: Lebowski stands for great actors, great characters, great photografhy, great directing, great music and great directing! I voted a 10. because there's really nothing in the film I don't find hilarious. Greating from the Netherlands, Murat

I can say only one thing about this brilliant MASTERPIECE... It´s like a 5000 pieces puzzle that fits perfectly. EVERYTHING in this movie is like it should be. Nothing more, nothing less. The characters, the story, the music, the photography, it all fits together like it was ment to be. This is a piece of art.

the Coen brothers have a visionary brilliance that becomes more than clear as your watching this movie. ive heard it referred to as a love/hate movie, and it seems to be that the people that hate this movie are the ones looking for a quick hour and a half pie in the face. And the people that love this film realize the vision of its directors and the undeniable hilarity that slowly unfolds with each viewing. That is the real beauty behind this movie. The ability of the Coen Brothers to create an atmosphere of subtle nuances and situations that only get funnier every viewing. And every situation you'll learn is incredibly funny. It seems like everytime you watch the movie, no matter how many many times you watch it, you see or hear something new, something that didnt seem to be there last time, and along with the deep interwining events and cleverly crafted dialogue between each absolutely unique character forces you to almost second guess your own mind, and creates an unique atmosphere that most movies could only wish to attain. Oh, and i did mention is funny, right? Funny.

reviews.review_title: The Big Lebowski, review with a focus on theme.
reviews.content: The Big Lebowski could be considered one of the greatest films of all time. In the film Jeffery Lebowski, or "The Dude," as he is more commonly known (Jeff Bridges) is a lazy man who enjoys bowling, smoking weed, drinking white Russians, and listening to classic rock (especially Creedence Clearwater Revival). His life does not seem to extend beyond these simple pleasures, nor does The Dude seem interested in branching out. "The Dude abides," as he says in self reference. This all changes when a couple of thugs try to shake him down for money owed by another man named Jeffery Lebowski, and one of them urinates on The Dude's rug. The Dude is convinced by his friend Walter, played by John Goodman, to go to the rich Jeffery Lebowski and ask him to replace the rug. Thus begins The Dude's story, which involves a ransom kidnapping, mystery, double-crosses, sex, and severed digits.The theme of The Big Lebowski is difficult to define at first, but perhaps it is best summed up by the Stranger, played by quintessential cowboy Sam Elliot, who says, "Sometimes there's a man who, well, he's the man for his time and place... that's the Dude in Los Angeles." That being said, the entire film seems to be an elaboration on this statement. Although the Dude is a painfully ordinary man, he finds himself in an extraordinary situation, and the audience is given the opportunity to see how he handles himself. Every character in the film is ordinary, however. As the story progresses, the power players, the criminal masterminds, and the femme fatal are all exposed to be just ordinary people lashing out in various ways as they do what they think they have to in order to survive. Through their collective actions, however, and extraordinary situation is created. This statement on human nature and especially the social implications of Los Angeles culture during the early 90's is both fascinating and hilarious. This integration of normal people and strange circumstances are characteristic of Coen brother screenplays, and although not as dry as Fargo, there are definite similarities in theme. The main difference in The Big Lebowski is that each of the characters seem to see themselves as some romanticized Hollywood character, each is the hero in their story. The one exception to this being the Dude, who is just happy to be himself, but gets caught in everyone else's stories.The theme is enhanced by the natural lighting techniques employed throughout the film. The bowling alley scenes are all awash in harsh fluorescent lighting, every detail and flaw of the middle-aged and mostly out of shape characters is bared for the cameras. In fact, most of the locations in the film appear to use the natural lighting, with only minor enhancements if necessary. These are all ordinary places, full of ordinary people. Along these same lines, the music for the film is wonderful. T-Bone Burnett, the musical archivist for the film chose an eclectic mix of music from Bob Dillon to Captain Beefheart, Nina Simone to Piero Piccioni, with surprises such as the Gypsy Kings covering Hotel California, and even some breathy, erotic chanting. The soundtrack is where the egos of these ordinary people can flourish, and the song for every scene is perfect considering the character of the chief protagonist/antagonist. The music allows the audience to see what each character hopes that they are projecting, despite their extremely human behavior. If this point was not obvious enough, the Nihilists (including Red Hot Chili Peppers bassist Flea) actually carry a boom-box blasting German techno when they attack the Dude and his friends. The are just ordinary people, in an extraordinary situation, acting in very human ways while projecting Hollywood egos.Kudos goes to the Coen brothers and a fantastic cast for this incredible film.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies ever made.
reviews.content: This movie was excellent, Jeff Bridges role was excellent, John Goodmans was as well. I also thought Tara Reid was hotter than ever in her short role. The plot of the movie and what unfolds is incredibly funny... I suggest anyone who wants a laugh should see this. There are only 2 other comedies in history that come close to touching this one... Those are Fletch and Dumb and Dumber. See this movie

reviews.review_title: This is one of the best movies of all time ...
reviews.content: Although it is not the most high brow entertainment out there, The Big Lebowski and its host of amazingly idiosyncratic characters is mentally stimulating and for the most part laugh out loud funny.We follow The Dude who happens to fall into a host of unsettling and hilarious events, all due to the name Jeffry Lebowski, of which he shares with a multi millionaire whose young wife is kidnapped.One of the best movies of all time for seriously good one liners, many of which I find myself repeating on a day to day basis. I am what you would call a little obsessed with this movie but I still think that for anyone looking for a beautifully shot, well written, pitch black comedy with a kick ass soundtrack this movie is a must see!

reviews.review_title: Quite possibly the funniest movie ever made.
reviews.content: Quite possibly the funniest movie ever made.  The first time I saw this movie, I didn't quite get it, but I knew there was something there.   Then it hit me and I absolutely could not stop laughing.  John Goodman and Jeff Bridges complement each other fantastically in this movie.  This movie also showcases just how dynamic an actor Jeff Bridges can be.

The Big Lebowski is a unique comedy from the Coen brothers. It is about a man called "Dude" or "The Dude" whose life is a complete train wreck. His actual name is Jeff Lebowski and the narrator calls him "the laziest man in Los Angeles County." Consequences ensue when Dude is mistaken for a very rich man with the same name. Written and Directed by Ethan and Joel Cohen. Jeff Bridges leads the cast which also includes John Goodman as Walter, Julianne Moore as Maude and Steve Buscemi as Donny. The Dude's favorite pastimes are bowling with Walter and Donny and smoking pot. The two main themes in this movie are man's existential struggle and abuse and mistreatment of one generation to the next especially the 50s to the 80s. Take the bowling for instance, bowling is respected in this movie and several of the dream sequences involve the characters at the bowling alley. Anyone can go play bowling pretty cheaply but it's a professional sport. It is also an older expression of fun. All generations enjoy bowling. It's unifying. The Dude is symbolic of the 60's hippie happy peaceful pacifist stereotype. In the end, he didn't accomplish much. Walter finds offense in almost everything but claims not to worry about anything and takes every opportunity to remind anyone listening that he is a vet. Walter and The Dude are polar opposites yet turn out to be best friends. They must not have known each other in the 60s. The duo sets out on many a missions throughout the film but never end up with any results. Walter's constant interruptions and Donny never getting to speak and The Dude's struggle to explain most of his situations when only a few words would do become a running gag throughout the film. Some see it as a indictment of 60's counterculture. If instead of screaming about what they didn't want, they had articulated what they did want, perhaps they would have achieved more. For some, the 60's revolutionaries are looked upon as the century's losers. Donny's name is reminiscent of the 70's due to a famous brother and sister duo. He is constantly being interrupted, yelled at, and ignored by Walter and The Dude. He is shy, bland, a tag-a-long, and just a step behind. He admires Walter and The Dude but doesn't have the same moxy. This contributes to his fear-induced death. Donny is the only one of the three that actually bowls. The Dude never touches a ball and Walter picks one up for another scene but does not bowl with it. A generation lost and ignored. Jesus (John Turturro) represents the flip-side of the 70s a possible pedophile clad in a purple jumpsuit. He is sexually aggressive, colorful, loud but ultimately all posturing and no action.Similar movies would include Raising Arizona, The Big Sleep, Blood Simple, Barton Fink, Fargo, The Long Goodbye, Miller's Crossing, Punch-Drunk Love, Trees Lounge, and Rob Roy. Many techniques were used in this film especially in the dream scenes. The lighting the angles were perfect. It was so original and fun. These scenes were vital to the theme's message and they way they shot them was perfect. This is one of those movies you love or hate. You either get it or you don't. The first viewing is so unique and for me it took multiple viewings and a deep love for the film to really fully understand and appreciate it. The themes are relevant and the Coens are geniuses.

The Big Lebowski revolves around a case of mistaken identity complicated by extortion, double-crosses, deception, embezzlement, sex, marijuana, and gallons of White Russians. Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski (Jeff Bridges), one of the laziest men in LA county, which would put him high in the running for laziest worldwide, enjoys hanging with his bowling buddies, gun-toting ex-Vietnam vet Walter Sobchak (John Goodman) and mild-mannered ex-surfer Donny (Steve Buscemi). When "The Dude" Lebowski is mistaken for the millionaire Lebowski (David Huddleson), two thugs urinate on his rug that "really tied the room together" (1998) to coerce him into paying a debt he knows nothing about. While attempting to gain compensation for the ruined rug from his wealthy counterpart, he accepts a one-time job with a high pay-off, and enlists the help of Walter. Deception leads to more trouble, and it soon seems that everyone from porn empire tycoons to nihilists want something from "The Dude." The main theme of The Big Lebowski is disunity. All of the relationships among the elements in the film The Big Lebowski may seem to be enigmatic with each other, but this style of film creates an integrated system of disunity The Coen brothers, like Guy Ritchie and his movies Snatch and Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, constantly use in their films divergence to leave the viewer and the characters in disarray with the plot. In the film The Big Lebowski the main character, Jeffery Lebowski, refers to himself as "The Dude". This element of the story becomes a motif. "The Dude" is referred to, and refers to himself as "The Dude" because it represents his personality, which is an easygoing "cool" character. The common Western society slang which is associated with the word dude is male prostitute. As the stranger says in his opening monologue "there's a name no man would self-apply where I come from" (1998). "The Dude" is continuously used by his friends and business associates through out the whole film. Although presented as a laid-back cool character, the Dude's title is representative of how he is seen by everyone around him.Bowling is a major part of the film The Big Lebowski. The art of bowling is played as a highly stylized ritual, and several dream/acid flashback sequences center around the game. Many different camera angles are used in bowling sequences from the up close shots of bowling balls on the lanes, to the almost cartoony dream sequences of "The Dude." One camera angle in particular that best represents the film is when the dude is dreaming and he is miniaturized and ends up inside a ball rolling down the lane. The camera rolling around and around, ceiling to floor, with occasional glimpses of the pins and the bowler represents the jumbled, topsy-turvy world of "The Dude" in the film. He never knows which way is up and what to believe. The entire film "The Dude" is left confused by the situation in which he has found himself in, and every time he thinks he has it figured out he is tossed in another direction that only leads to more confusion and befuddlement.The theme of The Big Lebowski is eclectic with its different motifs and divergent storyline, and the best way to summarize it comes from the opening monologue and "The Stranger's" introduction of "The Dude": Way out west there was this fella I wanna tell ya about. Goes by the name of Jeff Lebowski. At least that was the handle his loving parents gave him, but he never had much use for it himself. See, this Lebowski, he called himself "The Dude". Now, "Dude" - there's a name no man would self-apply where I come from. But then there was a lot about the Dude that didn't make a whole lot of sense. And a lot about where he lived, likewise. But then again, maybe that's why I found the place so darned interestin'. See, they call Los Angeles the "City Of Angels"; but I didn't find it to be that, exactly. But I'll allow it as there are some nice folks there. 'Course I ain't never been to London, and I ain't never seen France. And I ain't never seen no queen in her damned undies, so the feller says. But I'll tell you what - after seeing Los Angeles, and this here story I'm about to unfold, well, I guess I seen somethin' every bit as stupefyin' as you'd seen in any of them other places. And in English, too. So I can die with a smile on my face, without feelin' like the good Lord gypped me. Now this here story I'm about to unfold took place in the early '90s - just about the time of our conflict with Sad'm and the I-raqis. I only mention it because sometimes there's a man... I won't say a hero, 'cause, what's a hero? Sometimes, there's a man. And I'm talking' about the Dude here - the Dude from Los Angeles. Sometimes, there's a man, well, he's the man for his time and place. He fits right in there. And that's the Dude. The Dude, from Los Angeles. And even if he's a lazy man - and the Dude was most certainly that. Quite possibly the laziest in all of Los Angeles County, which would place him high in the runnin' for laziest worldwide. Sometimes there's a man, sometimes, there's a man. Well, I lost my train of thought here. But... aw, hell. I've done introduced it enough.

You can try very hard for a long time to find something wrong with this film. Don't bother trying. There isn't anything. The script is wonderful ( as you'd perhaps expect from the Coens ), the casting and acting is spot on, the music is great and, above all, the feel of the whole thing is sublime. Pathos and humour in equal measure. Its difficult to pick out the best bits, there are so many memorbale lines and moments. Jeff Bridges looks born from the role of the Dude, Steve Buscemi and wonderfully understated, Julianne Moore almost unrecognisable quirky but it is John Goodman that steals the whole thing for me. His performance as Walter is one of the best you will see and is the main reason that you can watch this film over and over. It doesn't matter that you know what is going to happen and what he is going to say, the performance never disappoints. Whenever I travel on business I only ever take 1 DVD with me. The choice is always the same.
